title: A Nail Tech's View: A great sampler set. So fun!
text:
This is a great sampler set by KRISNICE. You get a black polish to use as a base or on its own, a couple of color changing polishes, a couple of cat eye polishes, and a sparkly red polish. They are all beautiful and the effects all work well. The cat eyes do require a few coats to get good coverage, and a bit of practice with the magnet to get a good design. The good thing about those are, you can always swipe through the design and start over till you get something you like, and then cure. I love the color changing ones the best, but they only show two toned on longer nails. Otherwise, they just change from one color to another, which is still pretty.
The huge thing about this company's sets that I don't like, is they are not labeled. Yes, you get stickers to swatch, but they don't stick! You end up having to glue them on or make other swatches. I really wish they would label or swatch the bottles. I'm starting to not get polish from brands that don't label. It's just such a hassle.
Overall, I love all the colors and effects. You can really come up with some unique nail designs with this set. I love the color change with one layer of the purple cat eye over top. This is a good mix and a lot of fun! I would recommend

title: A Stylist's View: Has defects and is unusable. Bad customer service.
text:
The straight razor (shavette) I received is far from being professional quality nor could it be an heirloom that can be passed down in the family. It is made from cheap materials and has several defects.
The clasp is so thinly made, that it is easily bent just from disengaging it from the spine. There is a gouge on one spine that goes in on one side and out on the other. And, the razor blade does not stay seated properly once clasped. The wooden scales are not neatly finished. The blades that come with it are not the snap kind. They are full double sided blades, making them more dangerous to have to cut them without getting cut. They are also very thin and cheap. There's no way I can shave a neck, sideburns, facial hair, etc., with this defective razor.
I could have overlooked cosmetic issues regarding a razor of this price point. It is the physical defects that hindered its use that are major problems for me.
I contacted the seller, but was told that I could keep the defective product, and "we recommend another straight for you, better than that one in your hand", and I was given the asin number, so I could purchase it. This was not only poor Customer Service, but a lack of confidence in this, their own product. If they don't recommend this razor, I certainly don't either. It really could have gone much better.

title: A Nail Techs view: Perfect kit for the beginner! Great customer service. 5 stars⭐
text:
This Belle polygel kit is a great starter set from beginner to expert levels. It has some beautiful neutral colors, along with a white, and gorgeous glitters. They are all half ounce size tubes that will create a few sets of nails each, or you can mix and match the colors to make them go farther.
This kit includes; Six .5 oz. polygel colors, primer, gel base and top coats, a nail strengthener, cuticle oil, slip solution, dual forms, polygel brush with spatula, nail clips, and alcohol wipes. It comes nicely packaged in a lovely black box with cutouts to hold everything in place.
At minimum, you will need to supply your nail prep and finishing tools and liquids, such as: cuticle pusher and possibly nippers, a buffer, and nail dehydrator/alcohol, but these are things you will want to keep in good supply, anyways.
This polygel is so easy to work with. It is not too hard nor too soft. It's very easily workable with the provided slip solution. Even a beginner will have no trouble using it. Just remember, that if your surrounding temperature gets too cold or too hot, it affects the viscosity of the polygel, so work in a room that feels nice.
I did two nail swatches; one solid glitter and the other a French manicure with a shimmery twist. As I said, the polygel applied so easily, it also cured as expected without any problems, and the end results turned out beautiful.
I have to say that when I received my Belle polygel kit, there was a small issue with my order. I contacted their customer service and was met with such kindness and prompt service. They answered all my questions very quickly and respectfully. They're promptness in solving my problem, and their patience in dealing with my questions, shows me that they really care about their customers. Knowing that they were not privy to my customer status lets me know that they will treat all customers the same.
The colors are all so beautiful, and the glitters really make a statement. This set would make a great addition to anyone's collection and would also make a wonderful gift. Knowing this polygel kit is also backed by Belle, a wonderful company who really values their customers, makes a great product even better. I would most definitely recommend it!

title: Soothing and hydrating. 5 stars⭐
text: I love how this Essence has such soothing and hydrating ingredients. I've just recently started using K-beauty products, but the first one I tried left my skin very irritated. This one feels so light, but moisturizing. I'm just learning about a lot of the ingredients that are in most Korean beauty products, and I'm also Learning that some of them do not do well with my skin. This one works wonderfully for me. I use Retin-A, so anything really harsh or very exfoliating is too much. The first one made my skin very red, swollen, and angry looking. This one feels very nice on my skin and I love the way my skin is looking and feeling now. I would definitely recommend it! Especially, for those using Retin-A or those with very sensitive skin.

title: The whole set makes my skin feel much softer, plumper, and hydrated. 5 stars⭐
text: using this set for about a week now and I love it. It really makes a difference in how my skin feels. It's plumper, much softer and smoother, and well hydrated. It's not heavy or greasy and sinks easily into my skin. I'm so glad that I got to try the skin softener and the cream. They work very well together and with my other products, as well. I look forward to trying other products by this brand. Definitely recommend!

title: First time trying snail mucin, but it won't be the last. Excellent Stuff! 5 stars⭐
text:
This is my first experience trying anything with snail mucin in it and also some of the other ingredients, like peptides and adenosine. I can't say which one it is for sure, but I suspect it's the snail mucin that made a noticeable and immediate difference in my skin.
My forehead skin has a few dimples and I have some fine lines and wrinkles under my eyes. I am 50 years old, but I've been using Retin-A for several years now. I've had a mostly natural skin care routine, other than the Retin-A, but recently decided to try a few of the K-beauty products out. This one was the first I used, and with the first use I can see my forehead and wrinkles were much smoother, along with the rest of my skin, as well. It also gave my skin a brighter look. With each use, it just gets better and better.
A little definitely goes a long way. Its texture is slimy, but I've found that I only need a very small amount to cover my face, and it massages in so easily. I also apply it to my neck & decollete.
I'm so glad that I tried this, and now I will just keep adding to it until I get the full K-beauty routine down. I would gladly purchase this again and I highly recommend it!

title: Great for Sun damage. 4 stars⭐
text: I don't have an uneven skin tone on my face, but I do on my decollete area. I'm using this serum there instead of on my face, and I love the consistency and how well it sinks into my skin. I also love the pump bottle that keeps it fresh and free from contaminants. It does have an odd scent, but it doesn't linger long. Once I add my moisturizer, I don't notice it anymore. I haven't been using it long enough to notice a big difference yet, but my skin does feel smoother and softer overall. I would recommend it.

title: Much more than just hyaluronic acid! Very moisturizing and best fitting for my face. 5 stars⭐
text:
I love these masks! For the price and how many you get, I was surprised to find the plastic backing. I really like this, because I can open it up and make a few cuts using the plastic and its cutouts as my guide to make it easier. I cut right through the plastic and the mask at the same time. I always have to cut a little slit at both the inner and outer corners of the eye openings, and also the outer corners of the mouth opening, as I like to move my mouth a bit and I have extremely dry eyes and the serum always gets into them, if I don't. This also lets it lay down flat on my nose and eyebrows better. I also cut four slits at about 10 and 2 o clock and 4:30 and 7:30, or roughly equal spacing coming upward diagonally from my eyes and coming down and outwards diagonally from the corners of my mouth. My face is a bit small, and this helps me to be able to overlap those areas and make them fit better, especially with larger masks. With these, I have to do the shallowest cutting ever, because they fit so well. They cover my entire face better than any mask I've used. I haven't had a problem with them lifting up or drying out at all. It also helps with something I will share later in my review.
It takes a little finagling, but I manage to squeeze a bit of the serum off the mask while removing it from the package. I start before I even open the package by pushing all the serum to the bottom. I cut the top open, grab the top of the Mask, and fold the sides of the package inward, almost in half, using my non-dominant hand. I start pulling out the mask while squeezing the top closed around it as best I can. This squeezes out a good bit of the way too much extra serum that comes out if I don't do this.
I love hyaluronic acid, but these masks have so many more wonderful ingredients than just that. Almost every ingredient is so nutrient-rich or moisturizing for the skin. I use Retin-A and these are the most soothing masks 1 to 2 days after my application nights, which are every 3 nights. These moisturize my face so well and they feel great while I have them on. I don't want to take them off when the timer goes off. There's plenty of serum in the package to use elsewhere, like on your neck & decollete, and even on your hands. I always put a moisturizer on afterwards to hold all the nutrients and moisture in properly.
I learned a trick while back from another reviewer that I've been doing since I read it. When taking a mask off my face, I cut it into 4 pieces. Mainly, I cut them apart at the forehead, cheeks, and chin areas, using the four diagonal cuts I made, but you can make the cuts as you wish. I usually discard the small pieces that cover the nose and upper lip. I then take those four pieces, put them back in the serum that's left in the package remoisten them, with these that is no problem, or just add a little hyaluronic acid serum to moisten them again, put them on my neck and decollete area the best I can, and wait another 15 or 20 minutes. This really lets me get the most possible use out of every mask.
I really love these masks and all of the skin loving ingredients they contain. They make my face feel wonderful afterwards and the effects last all day, if not longer. These are definitely on my must-have list. Highly recommend!

title: Base coat brush dried up before finishing 2 nail swatches. 3 stars⭐
text:
I've used this brand's dip powders and thought they were great, so I wanted to give their liquids a try, as the powders did not come with them. I did two nail swatches, and before I was finished with the second one the base coat brush had dried almost completely out. It's unusable until cleaned. The top coat brush was also drying out.
Luckily a different brand sends several brushes along with their sets, and they actually fit these bottles. It would have been nice if this company had sent along extra brushes. A brush cleaner would have been nice, also. If I didn't have extra brushes, I would just be out of luck.
I've used so many dip liquids and have done so many dip nail sets, and this is the first time I've ever had a brush dry out. That doesn't make me feel good about using these liquids. I think I will stick with those that I know won't dry out.

title: A Nail Tech's view. Nice brush, but quite a bit smaller than other #8 brushes. 4 stars⭐
text:
This is a nice acrylic brush. It has a pretty pattern on the handle and the bristles are nice and straight. Though this #8 brush is smaller than all of my other #8 brushes, it works very well when applying acrylics. Whenever I get a new brush, I always do a burn test on a few of the bristle strands. The bristles in this brush are some kind of natural fiber or fur, but I can't say that it's a Kolinsky Sable, as true Kolinsky Sable is usually much more expensive. The bristles are rather short, leaving me to wonder how well the brush will hold up in the long run, but it should last a while..
Overall this is a nice acrylic nail brush, that has a very pretty pattern on its handle. It works well when applying acrylics, and I've had no problems with bristle loss. I would recommend this brush to those who are just starting out or those looking for a good budget brush.

title: Formaldehyde?! Not safe. 2 Stars ⭐
text:
After going over the ingredients in these products, the only two I would feel even remotely safe using would be this shampoo and conditioner. As a hair stylist, you do not want to use a product that contains formaldehyde and apply heat to it. You certainly do not want to use it every 6 weeks, as it's harmful to your health. It can cause breathing issues among other things. It's very hard to believe that I even saw actual formaldehyde on the back of this product, and so high up in the ingredients list.
Even hair stylist must wear protective gear, such as gloves, aprons, masks, and be trained how to safely work with this hazardous chemical. Salons must have adequate ventilation and follow strict protocols regarding blow dryer temperatures and monitor formaldehyde levels at all times when they provide Keratin Treatments containing formaldehyde because of the immediate and long term health dangers.This is something you cannot possibly do at home.
Also, the pretreatment that you add to the shampoo is extremely strong and stripping to your hair. When they say add just a little, no one knows what that means. That particular product, or the two main ingredients, should only be a small percentage of the product you're adding it to. I don't think you can mix this properly at home without causing damage to your hair and/or your skin.
I "might" use the shampoo and conditioner, but I will not touch the pre-treatment nor will I touch the DIY home keratin treatment. Over the course of a few treatments, I can see this product going really awry for some people. They will end up with damaged hair and possibly other problems. It is not safe. I absolutely would not recommend it!

title: Very moisturizing, but leaves too much oil behind. 3.5 stars ✨
text:
The name of these masks really throws you off. It makes you think they are supposed to be used with an LED light, but they are not. Upon opening one of the mask packages, I wasn't expecting a gooey, in between a cream and lotion, to start leaking out. It's not like a Serum at all.
The mask itself is quite thin, but it's not at all easy to tear. I read that one reviewer commented that it rips easily. On the contrary, it's quite difficult to even tear it. I actually had to use scissors to cut it for a use that I will explain later. It is a good size, covering all areas quite well. The cutouts for the eyes are quite small, which I like because it really gets to the under-eye area without it getting into your eyes.
I left it on for 20 minutes, and then did as another reviewer did, and cut it up and put it on my neck & decollete for another 20 minutes, with the rest of the cream/lotion that was left in the package.
This mask is extremely moisturizing and did not sink into my skin completely afterwards. I had used Retin-A the night before, so my face was quite dry, and really needed moisture and nutrients. But, I think it is a little too oily for my skin. My skin was still so oily hours later that I had to blot it with a microfiber facial cloth. The next day my skin felt great, though, without any ill effects.
These are very moisturizing and emollient masks, and would be great for someone with extremely dry skin. For me, I think these will work well using them once a week or every other week, when my skin is at its driest. For five masks, I think the price point is just right. I would definitely recommend these. Especially for those with very dry skin.

title: Very hydrating, but left my face sticky. 4 stars ✨
text:
This is only my second time using a face mask, and this one was a much better experience than the last. I chose the morning to do the mask while I was having my morning coffee, checking the computer, and using my LED White light therapy lamp. The Mask itself is made of a very durable fabric like material that does not tear. The serum is nice and silky feeling without any scent, that I could tell. I appreciate that, as I have a sensitivity to certain smells.
For me, the mask was a little bit short on the forehead and not wide enough on the cheeks. I don't have a large face at all, and I had quite a bit of skin left to cover around the sides and top.
There's an ample amount of serum left in the package that I was able to keep re-wetting the mask with, as it seemed to dry fairly quickly. I also rubbed some on my neck and decollete. I left it on for about an hour, so that my skin could soak in as much as possible. I then used the mask to rub the rest on my neck, decollete, and the backs of my hands. I wanted to make use of every bit I could. I use Retin-A on my face, and had done a treatment the night before, so my skin really needed the hydration and nourishment. It looked and felt very hydrated and nourished afterwards.
The only thing I did not care for was that my skin was very sticky after removing the mask, and it stayed that way. I ended up having to take a damp cloth and blotting it off. After that, my face felt a bit greasy, and I had to keep blotting it until it was time for my bedtime skincare routine.
Overall, I really enjoyed using this mask and will be using it at least once a week. It is very hydrating and nourishing, I just wish it didn't leave the sticky and greasy feeling behind. Maybe, I left it on too long, as I do have combination normal to oily skin. Next time I will only leave it on for about 15 minutes, as I think that may work much better for me. I would definitely recommend this mask, but would also recommend starting with less time than I did if you have combination to oily skin.

title: Somewhat good in theory, not so great in reality. 2.5 Stars ✨
text:
This mirror really wants to be elegant looking. It has a pearlized finish with some elegant swirls at the top, but it really just looks like a plastic vanity mirror that should come with one of the Barbie mannequin heads that little girls put makeup on and do their hair.
The mirror has three light settings, bright white, really yellow, and I'm assuming a daylight, which is the only light I can somewhat see myself a little bit with it on. Really, it's just awful trying to see in this mirror with the light on. This is the first lighted mirror that I've experienced this with. For some reason, the light seems to shadow your face somehow, or either it's just the wrong color or brightness, and you can hardly see yourself in the mirror at all. And, no matter which mirror I want to look in, I have to pick the mirror up and bring it close to my face. And even then, I feel like I'm looking at light, and not my face being brightened by the light.
Also, once put together, the fold out mirrors do not stay flush when folded in. It gives it the look like you've broken it and are just living with it like that. And, I find the fold out mirrors very cumbersome to look at myself in them, with the light on or off. Especially the bottom one that has the most magnification, which really should have been on the top, in my opinion. If I don't pick it up, I have to bend way down to see in the bottom one, and then I can only see half of my face if the light is on. The other half is in a shadow, whether the light is on or off. The upper mirror is just as hard to see in, as my face is shadowed on one side very heavily if the light is on. It's just an awkward design.
This mirror seemed somewhat good in theory, but because of the very poor design and the lack of quality materials, it is rendered nearly useless. Each mirror, in and of itself, is nice and clear and seems great. One might think of recycling them, or a young girl may find better use of this vanity mirror as she's playing dress up, or learning to do makeup. For myself, because I cannot see into it with the lights on, as it's meant to be used, and I don't find it aesthetically pleasing to display, I will not be using it.

title: Nice quality bottles with lots of the goodies! 5 stars ✨
text: These are good quality thick amber colored bottles, and they arrived very well packed. I love that they come with a funnel, labels, marking pen, a dropper, and screw top lids along with the sprayer tops. They work great for making my witch hazel facial toner spray and colloidal silver spray. The sprayers work pretty well, although the sprayer part spins around freely. It makes them feel a little clumsy and uneasy to grab hold of. The price for these is on the high side of what I would normally pay for a set like this. Aside from those couple things, they are very nice quality bottles that come with lots of goodies.

title: These are not USDA certified oils. 2 stars ✨
text:
First, I will say these oils seem fine. They work well together or apart, mixed into other skincare products or alone. I use these types of oils to make my own facial oil mix or to add to my moisturizer.
The thing I absolutely hate that companies do to try to sell their products is to say things that aren't true. The USDA does not certify oils - food, cosmetic, or otherwise. The fact that the bottle says this product is USDA certified on one side, and the other side says not intended for ingestion should speak volumes. The USDA certifies and regulates the welfare and production of food products; meaning products that you ingest. So, why on earth would they certify a product you cannot ingest? The bottle also makes outright claims of known cures from using these oils. There is no disclaimer on either bottle that states that these claims have not been approved or proven by the FDA, or whatever the disclaimer is that is mandatory. There are ingredients listed, one ingredient for each product, the oil, and that's it. Nothing tells how these oils were extracted. Therefore, we do not know if they are refined or unrefined. They probably don't know either. So you see, therein lies the lies and deception.
These oils would be much better if they weren't tied to lies. Because you know what they say about lies... if you tell one you have to tell more to keep up with the first one. Is what they say in the bottle really what's in the bottle? Are they pure oils or mixed with a lesser oil? Oils are greasy. If they are unrefined, why aren't they greasy? When you refine oils, you take away a lot of their natural properties and their nutritive value, is that why they aren't greasy? Because of the lies and lack of important information, I really don't know for sure what these oils are.
Because of the deceptive practices and claims made, I would not recommend these or any of their other oils.

title: Nice but missing the clips... 3 stars ✨
text: These travel-size bottles are really nice. I love that they are a larger size so that I can use them for hand sanitizer and facial care products. The ones for hand sanitizer can easily fit in my handbag and carry bag, and the ones for my facial care products fit nicely on the small caddy I have in my bathroom. They are easy to fill from my large pump containers, which is a plus. My only issue is that mine are missing the clips that go on them. It's not so terrible for the few that I use in my bathroom, but it is for the ones I use for hand sanitizer. It makes it harder to find them in my purse and bag. Hopefully, no one else has this problem. I would definitely recommend them if you get the clips.

title: Not very , but very loud. 3.75 Stars ✨
text:
I already had a large water flosser but was looking for something smaller and liked the idea of a rechargeable one. Upon first opening this flosser, it's very unique and different and would be great for traveling. The way the pieces of it fit together so compactly into each other, and then into a very nice fabric zip case with a handle, definitely sets this flosser apart.
When I used it, I found that it did not have near the amount of pressure that I'm used to from my other flosser. As nice as it is, it didn't feel as if it was cleaning between my teeth very well. I felt it gave a nice surface clean, but the pressure of the water was not enough to force out any particles from in between my teeth.
The flosser is also extremely loud. I've had the one I'm using for quite a while, and though it makes some noise, it isn't loud enough to hear from a couple of rooms away with the door shut. This one was scary loud. I'm not sure if it may have a defect or not, so others may not have this problem.
For me, this flosser does not have enough power behind it, and it is just too loud for my liking. I really wanted to like it, but it's not for me. I hope that others have a better experience than I did. 3.75 Stars ✨

title: Not the best and not the worst. 4 stars ✨
text: This is a nice kit for someone who is just starting out, who has a little patience to work with a semi-difficult gel. It has everything you need to create poly gel nails aside from the UV light. It is a little on the sticky side, but I find using a good quality hand sanitizer instead of the slip solution makes it a lot easier. All the colors cure very nicely, aside from the white. It does take a bit longer. And, I love that the clear is clear. It's nice that you get some glitters, along with the poly gel, to experiment with a bit of nail art to see if you like doing your nails at home, before investing a lot of money in supplies. Overall, I think this is a good budget starter kit if one has a bit of patience. 4 stars ✨

title: So many butterflies it's hard to choose! 5 stars ✨
text:
Wow! This set comes with so many different types of butterflies. I love how the butterfly stickers come in so many different colors that no matter what color polish should you choose to wear, there are so many butterflies that will go with it. Some of my favorite ones are the butterfly outlines that are shiny or holographic. Most of the color ones also shimmer, which is so beautiful.
I like that there are butterflies that are flying sideways and also complete butterflies. It gives nail art a lot more interest. Having the glitter butterflies is a bonus to play around with encapsulating. With this sticker and glitter kit, there are so many nail art designs you can create. I've done several, but my mind is filled with endless possibilities. Highly recommended! 5 stars ✨

title: Not my favorite. A little tacky, hard to cure, and doesn't last long. 3.5 Stars ✨
text:
In this kit, you get a nice set to complete a French tip design. You get 30 ml of each color, which is a wonderful size. You also get a base and topcoat, an application tool, and a couple of glitters. This would make the perfect kit if it didn't have a few issues.
So far, I've only used the clear and white poly gels to create a French tip design. They are a bit tackier than I would like them to be, which makes them harder to work with. They also take quite a bit longer to fully cure under an LED UV light than most other poly gels. I did use tips and dual forms. When I remove the dual forms after curing them for 60 seconds on top and bottom, they were still tacky on top. I had to cure them for another 30 seconds. My nails only lasted a little over a week before starting to lift around the edges. This is hardly a long-lasting poly gel, in my opinion.
I'm a still licensed but retired nail technician, so I am very well aware and knowledgeable on how to prep nails properly. User error was not the problem. These gels would be good for practice, but if you are looking for a poly gel that will last for more than a week, you may want to look at another brand. 3.5 Stars ✨

title: Uhh.... ok, will use for skincare routine, then. 3.5 stars ✨
text:
When I saw these I was so excited because they match most of my wardrobe. I'm always wearing my hair up and love wearing skinny hard headbands with ponytails to keep straggly hairs back. I thought this would be something new to try altogether.

Unfortunately, this fabric is awful to wear in your hair. I am a seamstress and it is definitely synthetic and feels like it. It's slippery, hot, and doesn't' feel nice at all. The design seems like an afterthought, as it will not stay in place.

So, I've had a big change of plans! I will be using these during my skincare routine and putting on my makeup. At least these headbands will get some use. I'm constantly losing the ones I have, so now I have plenty.

I'm giving these 3.5 stars for effort and couldn't bear to recommend them. Sorry.

title: Acrylic girl tries Polygel for the first time...crazy different!
text:
This was my first experience with poly gel, and I can't say that it was an easy and straightforward one. I did do some research and watched several videos to learn the process before even venturing into trying my own. Boy, I had NO idea what I had gotten myself into... This is nothing like my beloved Acrylics! But, for a little laugh, and a few Pro "lift proof" tips along the way, I've added a video at the top to show my adventure.

First, none of the nail forms seem to come close to fitting any of my nails properly, and my mind could not even grasp this whole strange concept not one bit. So, I just added a tip and began to apply the gel as I would acrylic. The gel is extremely thick and sticky and very hard to work with, unlike the gel from the past. The kit did not include a slip solution, which would be hard for those just starting out and may not have 70% alcohol at home. I did have some, but it really didn't help, aside from keeping the brush clean, as the gel was so thick and almost unworkable. It took me about 20 minutes to complete one nail from start to finish, including polish. 

It was quite frustrating that none of the boxes for the Polish were marked, neither did they have curing times noted. The instructions also did not include this information for the polishes. But, in the end, I had a pretty nice looking poly gel nail for the first time ever.

I appreciate that the kit comes with all the necessities, aside from the slip solution. It also contains quite a few glitters and tapes to get creative. The light is very small, but it gets the job done, even if it takes a few extra seconds. Once the nail is cured, you get a very hard and shiny finish. The polishes are very nice, although I don't care for a few of the colors myself, the topcoat is very thick.

Overall, I think this is a nice kit. I enjoyed the learning experience and will likely play around with it again. And, I may try those strange nail form attachment things. Although I could have done over half a set of nails in acrylic in the time it took to do my one nail in polygel~~ everyone has to start somewhere, it's always fun to learn something new and the first time usually takes the longest.

I would recommend this kit for those starting out new and fresh, or those who are seasoned a bit doing poly gel. You definitely get a lot for your money, and you will get a nice strong nail from this kit. I'm giving 4 stars ✨ for the lack of information on the packaging and instructions on colors and curing times. But, I really do think I will like it much better once I get the hang of it.

title: Why didn't they add another magnet, so you can trim them?
text:
This was my first magnetic eyeliner and eyelash kit. The eyeliner works great and the lashes adhere very well. The eyelashes themselves are beautiful and I love the lengths. The liner is easy to put on and so are the lashes. And, they stay on very well, with one exception.

The eyelashes are too wide for my eyes, and I need to cut the last magnet off for them to fit properly. But, when I do that the outer end flips up and makes the lashes look terrible. If I don't cut them, they stick into the inner corner of my eyes, causing major irritation and immediately flip up, also making them look terrible. 
I feel like they need one more magnet on the outer end, close to the last magnet. Because, most people need to trim any and all eyelashes, in order to make them fit their eyes better. In every video I've ever watched with glue on lashes, the person always has to trim the eyelashes just a little bit shorter in width. Why didn't the manufacturers of these eyelashes think that it would not be the same for these lashes?

I love the concept, and really wish that these worked for me, because I have very dry eyes and cannot wear eye makeup and mascara. They just need another magnet!

title: Perfect for little things...I'm not throwing away half used products and filling up landfills!!
text:
I have dry eyes, and these work great for using saline solution to clean around my eyes everyday several times. They're thin and soft, and just the right size, so that I don't feel like I'm wasting a large cotton round. I also use them to go over my face with witch hazel, after my nightly facial cleansing. It only takes one for each task. I haven't had any problems with them falling apart or being too thin for my needs. Using them for my purposes, the three pack has & will last me for a pretty long time.
It's nice to find the right size product for the right size need that I have. I highly recommend these to anyone who has light duty needs for cotton rounds, and doesn't want to feel like they're wasting money, and throwing away the majority of a product, because it was just too large for what they needed it for. We have enough trash in landfills.

title: and I am in love with all of it
text: I'm really on a kick of trying the whole OZ line...and I am in love with all of it. In fact, I find a way to use every serum over two days. I use Retin A every other night and use the vitamin c serum after using it. The next night, I use the Vitamin c with AHA and the Hyaluronic acid serums along with this one. I do wait about 10-15 minuites between each. But, I use the eye gel every night. They all work so well together and my skin is looking and feeling so much better. My biggest problems are large pores and uneven texture. My texture has evened out so much and my pores are surprising me more each day. I'd say these serums really have made the biggest difference in my pores. I kept seeing my grandmother's nose in the mirror, and I'm only 46--I was really self conscious. I'm starting to like looking in the mirror now...I'm seeing pretty quick changes and I like them.

title: Best Mascara but not flawless
text: It's an excellent long-lash mascara and it can be easily paired with other mascara fixers from Korean brands. As some bloggers said, it DOES irritate eyes a little and it is extremely hard to remove. So if you want to buy this, buy oily lip/eye cleanser together. In terms of mascara, it's an excellent mascara. It does not make your lashes spidery or so, and make the lashes curly, defined and longer for a whole day. I have tried multiple mascaras from Chanel, Lancome, and many Korean brands, but I think this mascara is still the best.

title: Great value
text: This is a great kit at a great value. I had a colored uv polish already but didn't have the base coat or top coat, so this is just what I needed. It also had instructions, which had some helpful tips if you're not used to doing your nails. The only thing I didn't like was that the polish was super thick - so thick it was hard to get an even layer on my nails without getting a huge gloop of it.

title: Nice foaming cleanser
text: I usually use one of those thick coconut milk cleansers and I don't usually like foaming ones. This one was good though. It feels nice and soothing on my skin - not harsh or drying like some foaming ones. It has a little bit of scent to it but not enough that I really notice if I'm not thinking about it.

title: Five star worthy
text:
If I could give these six stars I would. I was in the middle of purchasing a man scape replacement blade and saw that the Amazon vine program had one as a sample. This is not a paid review and not forced to give 5 stars.

They are identical as the official manscaped blade which is the reason I test tried them. It cuts the exact same way and pretty much identical to the original. Best part is that you get two of them.

Generally, they recommend replacing the blades every three months, but I've used my original 1 for over six months and as long as you clean the blade, wash it, as well as removing any hairs the buildup inside the original machine or on the blade itself one should last you about the same. Considering you get two of them for $20 (at the time of writing this review 4/20/2022) its a great deal.

I was getting ready to shave my chest and armpits and waited for the blades to get delivered. They cut identical as the original. You can either use it as a beard/face trimmer to keep very light stubble that is under a five o'clock shadow or simply use it to cut your chest hair or under the armpit for a closer shave.

title: I love the scent and the softness of the lotion
text: I put this on my body, hands and legs after a shower. It has nice fragrance and the feel of the oil on my skin is wonderful. I am used to the regular body lotions such as Dove, Nivea and St. Ives, all with water base, but this "oily" product is a welcome change. It feels very soft and silky and the skin does not itch. It is therapeutic for someone who has dry skin. I usually put every day in the morning after shower, and do not feel itchy all day. This is a nice alternative to water based body lotions.

title: Great pencil, but the Gray-brown color was too dark for me.
text:
I really like this pencil, but the color, gray brown, was too dark for me and I couldn't use it. As there was no other color that would be better, I can't buy this product; however, if you can find a good color for you the quality and ease of application is wonderful.
I also recommend that they stamp the name of the company on the actual pencil so that if I ever wanted to buy it again I would know how to do that. Right now, the pencil that has no writing, only the color number 04 at the bottom.

title: Good lotion, expensive, and in a poorly designed container.
text:
This lotion would get five stars, but I think it's expensive for what it is and the container is definitely not user-friendly.
If it had been in a tube it would have gotten four stars from me.
The lotion itself is very thick and emollient. It is gentle and has virtually no fragrance.
But getting it out of the plastic bottle with a difficult to use top meant squeezing really hard. More work than I want for a bit of moisturizer.

title: Review for shampoo, not lotion.
text:
As they sent me the shampoo, this review is for that.
I think it's excellent quality and has a super leather. It cleaned my hair beautifully and left it fairly soft, but that was with a rinse out conditioner, too.
I would highly recommend it.

title: I have been using it for months and love it!
text:
I have been using this eye cream for months, day and night, and just adore it. It's very emollient without being greasy at all.

I am usually sensitive to products and this gave me no negative reactions.

It only takes a tiny little bit to moisturize my upper and lower lids. Of course, I stay away from the eyelash area as I don't want any of this in my eyes.

One jar has lasted for months.

The only thing I don't like is the container as it means sticking my finger into it and I really don't like that delivery system. I would vastly prefer if it had a small nozzle tube that could stand on its end. I know it wouldn't look as fancy, but it would be far more user friendly.

title: I could barely get this to apply to my brow…old product?
text:
This was pretty impossible to use. It was so dry and hard that it wouldn't even apply color to my brow. I
I would strongly suggest going with the Maybelline brow precise or the Maybelline brow ultra slim. Both of those are phenomenal and fairly priced. I think you can get them with Amazon's subscribe and save, too.

title: Exactly what I've been looking for. Fantastic hold with no residue or helmet head.
text:
A tiny spritz of this not only holds my hair, but makes it look fuller.
I imagine it will last a long time; so, its also a great value.
I was always loath to try these freeze-type hairsprays, thinking they would look stiff, but this doesn't.
No discernible fragrance, either.

title: Super attractive clippers and file in a leather look case.
text:
I really loved the modern look of these clippers and file; however, i took one star away as the small nail file is not as sharp as I would have liked. I'm used to an old Revlon diamond file that works much faster.
As others have said, you can very easily remove the black base on the nail clippers if it seems unwieldy to you. It felt just fine to me.

title: What a bargain!
text: Great color selection.  One for every mood or outfit. Very effective product. I have baby fine hair, but a lot of it.  These work very well.

title: Best Wash Cloth
text: Best bathing cloth ever.  This is such a satisfying exfoliating cloth, and is the perfect size.  You will need much less soap to get a great lather from these.

title: Buy this for baby skin!
text: Will never use any other cloth again.  It leaves your skin feeling like a baby's.  Holds so much more body cleanser, too.

title: Great For Body Oils
text:
This roller works great with my body oils. It dispenses just enough while smoothly gliding over your skin. I find that putting it in the refrigerator before applying gives the roller a nice cooling effect.

The only issue is that the bottle leaks a little when using and should always remain upright.

title: Not An Extra Large
text: Unique and well designed, but there is no way that these are extra large shower caps.  They are average in size at best.  They are cute and adjustable, but not an extra large.

title: I Don't Know How I Feel About This
text:
Pros:

Very cute and compact facial massager in the shape of a lipstick tube. It comes with a USB cable. The massager charges very quickly for immediate use.

Cons:

I feel that the massager is a little weak to actually work. I feel most of the vibration at the base of the product, and not much at the tip. Also, the heating element of this product is very weak. It barely gets warm.

title: I didn't expect to like these
text:
Let's start out by explaining that I have longer (waist length), fine hair, but a lot of it. Nothing stays in my hair. It tangles like a beast. I've pretty much been living with my hair in a braid for the last year because it is the only thing I can do that doesn't end up in a huge mess but also mostly stays-well, except for all the frizzies and flyaways that sneak out. So I was looking for another fast alternative to get my hair back and out of my face that also wouldn't require an hour of brushing to undo.
These were cheap, and Amazon is always so great about returns, that I decided to give it ago. I figured, at worse, at least it would be a simple-ish way to pull my hair back when I am working at the computer. And they are. 20 seconds and my hair is back in a bun without the discomfort of lots of other hair styles. I mean, they are actually surprisingly comfortable.
But what I did not expect is for them to hold so well! I put my hair in a high bun yesterday then went for a run. I had fully intended to take the bun out and put my hair in a braid, because there was no way this thing would hold through a run, but IT DID! 7 miles later, my bun was still secure and tight, but comfortable and looked as good (which honestly wasn't that good to begin with) as it did when I first put it up. I could not believe it held through the entire run.
In all honesty, they are a bit fussy to use, and I have not perfected making it look like a perfect doughnut bun. But I'm not looking for winning style awards. I just wanted a simple way to get my hair up and back that would hold for a few hours. And in that aspect I got way more than I bargained for.
Very impressed, very pleased, very glad I took a chance!

title: My hair has never been so soft
text: I am a 54 yr old woman with the kinkiest, frizziest hair you have ever seen!  This product has made my hair so soft, manageable and shiny that I wish I had discovered sooner!  It is wonderful!!!

title: Better than expected!
text: These are gorgeous brushes!  I was not expecting the amount of sparkle on the handles (metal). I am not a profession makeup artist, but simply a casual (light but daily) makeup wearer that needs some brushes for powder and eyeshadow.  These are soft but full and brush hairs have not fallen out.  They work well for my needs with the added bonus of making me smile when I see them sparkle.

title: Not greasy but a little watery.
text: I have been hearing about Rosemary oil for a long time thus I got this product. I tried this on my husbands hair/scalp. It was not too greasy like the other oil for hair growth that he used. In fact, it is a little watery and lightweight and dries out easily. I had to pour more as I apply it to the rest of his scalp unlike the products which he previously used where a tiny amount would do. As to the scent, we both like it. As for the effectiveness, I have to update on this as it has been just 4 days since he started using this to tell any difference. Also, he didn't develop any itchiness on his scalp.

title: SOTICA 200PCS Tattoo Pen Bags and 6PCS Tattoo Grip Tape
text: I got these for my daughter in law. She said they are very well made and a great quality. They work really well and are a great value for how many you get.

title: Fantastic, especially for the price.
text: I really like this mascara. It definitely lengthens my lashes. It's creamier than any others I've had, and goes on really smooth. There was absolutely no clumping and it made my lashes look feathery. I'm not sure about being waterproof. I didn't test that out.

title: Multi-certified, coarse alum for general use but not what you might expect for a powder
text:
Herbs Botanica Alum Powder offers a multi-certified, coarse alum that is good for general use but not what you might expect for a powder.

PROS
• Appropriate for multiple uses
• USDA Organic, vegan, and other certifications
• Bag includes recipes for use
• Double-packaged with a bag of the alum inside of a paper, resealable bag
• Decent value of level of quality

CONS
• Often, alum is ground to a fine powder. At least half of this alum, however, is like what you would expect of coarse sea salt—not a powder, as described. Get out the mortar and pestle, and you shouldn't have any trouble making a fine powder for deodorant mixtures, dying, and other common uses. This downside is not significant enough for me to strip away a star, but buyers should be aware of the coarser-than-usual alum.

title: Super easy to use….flap completely opens like a file folder instead of enclosed bag
text:
So much easier than a cosmetics bag. Simply on snap and open the flap. All of your brushes are now laying there and easy to access!!

The clear plastic should easily wipe up/clean overtime. The trim is made of white which I suspect we'll get dingy with make up with US. Would you prefer a different color to not sure wear.

Great concept if you have a lot of cosmetic brushes and tools!

title: Online photos show ice roller with flower in it?
text:
I should have read the description more closely instead of looking at the first few photos. I thought the device came with something inside that you freeze and apply to the face. The online photos show a flower inside. What the device is in reality is a plastic container that you fill with water, take the lid off and roll on your face.

Easy to use ✅

Soft durable plastic ✅

Washes/cleans easily ✅

Helps with swelling/puffiness ✅

Online photos suggest adding ingredients to your water before freezing such as roses for skin whitening. Very skeptical a rose in ice will whiten my skin. 👎

Gets messy as the ice melts. 👎

title: Great value but must have UV light
text:
Good product. Comes with detailed instructions on how to use. The directions are accurate.

Do not buy this product unless you have an UV light. I tried using without a UV light out of curiosity. The first polish in the process would not cure without the UV light. FYI.

Easy to use and does dry fast with a UV light. Definite advantage.

Gel polish is much harder to remove which is good and bad. Good because it lasts longer but bad when you need to remove.

Great price point!

title: Great quality and value
text:
These hair clips are adorable!

They arrive in a cute gift box. Presentation is everything and they did a good job with this one. This product would make an excellent birthday gift for a young girl or a stocking stuffer.

The clips easily go in and out of the hair. They are comfortable to wear.

The colors of the stones are exactly the colors shown in the online photos. There is no misrepresentation.

I would highly recommend these for the $$.

title: Can use it more than once
text: Hair was of good quality and easy to use

title: Mask/face wash easy cheah grEaT tyTYty
text: one of the very best~top five for price tyTYty

title: The bristles seems softer than other brushes
text: [[VIDEOID:d4ce3b11e013e715a72f58191c41086d]] I like the size of this brush. I also like how the bristles seem softer than other brushes. My dog doesn't really care to be brushed ever, but he does not seem to mind this one as much as he minds the other ones.

title: Wish they'd come with plastic shields.
text:
These manage to be very generic looking. Which is fine, but interesting that I could notice considering it's just a toothbrush head. They just don't have the decorative banding on them that some of the others have (they do have the color band for distinguishing between multiple users). What I don't like is that they do not have the plastic shields with them, although even the originals don't have that anymore. As my remaining shield gets cracked further and further, I wonder how I will continue to travel with my brush.

These seem basically the same as the originals. It's sort of hard to say if my perception that they are just a tad less good is based on something substantial or just aesthetics and packaging. If the price is right, they're worth a try.

title: Beautiful gift set.
text: (Wife) Is a very beautiful and complete set of brushes and a silicone device to clean them after each use or when you think is necessary. Is perfect for a gift, it comes in a cute bag in a box easy to wrap of just put in a gift bag. The bristles are very soft and gentle on your skin. It also has a cover to keep them nice and tight so it doesn't lose its shape.

title: Clean fresh mouth!
text: This is wonderful and replaces counter clutter.

title: Multiple uses for cold therapy
text:
This little tool is going to see many types of use in my home. I suffer from migraines, so cold therapy is my go to for those. In addition to headaches, we also have out share of muscle aches and bumps and bruises. This tool will be great for giving those localized attention without the bulk of an ice pack. We can also control the pressure applied.

The two heads are easily popped on and off. It's nice that you get two, because you can always have a spare in the freezer, and switch them out when needed. This is also going to be a great cool down tool for my husband after doing yardwork. The Texas sun is brutal in the summertime. Applying this to his face and the back of his neck is going to be a real treat. I think that with the multiple uses this provides, it's worth grabbing one.

title: Skin softening
text: This is a small jar of very smooth cream. It applies very easily and comfortably on the skin, but it does have a really off-putting scent, for me. I'm not sure what the smell is but I find it to be really unpleasant. But the mask itself does leave skin very soft, which I appreciate. I find that sleeping masks don't always work well for me, because I'm a side sleeper with a lot of sleep disturbance issues. So I end up wiping my face on my pillow all night through shifting and trying to get comfortable, and emollient sleep masks may not really get to do their full thing on my skin at night. Still, this mask does get points for how moisturizing it is, and for how it softens the skin.

title: Great headband
text: The headband is not too thick. It is just right for an outdoor walk in colder weather. The size is right and it doesn't feel tight or loose on the head. It covers the ears. I recommend it

title: Good but strongly scented
text: This is a unique product idea with a face oil and a face cream in one container. The two products are dispensed together via one pump, then mixed as you apply to your face. It feels good on my skin, providing a lot of moisturizing without feeling greasy, even on my combination skin. It does, however, have a much stronger scent than I like; I prefer my face products to be unscented.

title: No results to speak of
text: The bristles on the mascara wand were too long for my liking. As for the mascara itself, it's very thin, almost kind of runny, and I found it didn't do much for my lashes. It didn't seem to cling to my lashes. I kept applying more coats, but still didn't see great results. This one isn't for me.

title: Works well on dirty paws...if it fits
text:
These types of paw washing cups are an excellent way to clean muddy paws. I'm so glad the days of lugging a bucket of water are behind me. I've tried a couple different versions and found this one to be good, if it fits your dog's paws.
I have a golden retriever. The box I received said “medium” and it works for her, though it's a little tight. There are a lot of silicone bristles inside and while that's good for cleaning, if you're on the borderline of it fitting your dog, too many bristles make it difficult to get your dog's paws in and out and to agitate the cup enough to clean. I didn't see a size noted when I ordered, so I'm not quite sure if it's possible to order different sizes since I don't see that info on the Amazon page, just on the box I received.
Cleaning the cup is easy - just rinse if the water isn't too dirty or unscrew the top and remove the silicone bristle insert for a deeper clean.
The included towel is nice and fluffy, but only the size of a standard washcloth. My dogs feet come out pretty wet, so the cloth is soaked by the time I'm done wiping her feet. I use a towel instead.

title: Kind of chunky and quite oily, but leaves skin feeling soft
text: I've used a number of different salt scrubs and love them for how soft they leave my skin feeling after a shower. This one is a little chunkier than most and feels rougher on my skin. It is also quite oily. I like some oil in my scrubs for moisturizing, often I don't even need to apply lotion after using, but this one seemed extra oily and left the shower slippery. It separates, so needs to be shaken or stirred before using. It does leave my skin feeling smooth and provided you like coconut, the scent is nice.

title: Did not work for my thick, curly hair
text: I love the smell of this conditioner so was eager to try it. Unfortunately, it did almost nothing for my hair. I have thick, curly hair and require a lot of conditioner. I used the same amount of this Taza conditioner as I would any other, and it was strange in that it felt like I hadn't put anything on my hair. There was no silky feel, I could not comb my fingers through may hair. I enjoyed the scent, but my hair felt as if I hadn't put any conditioner on it. I tried adding more, but it didn't help. I ended up rinsing it and using a different conditioner. If your hair doesn't require much conditioning, this may work for you, but if your hair is anything like mine, this probably isn't for you.

title: Patience required
text:
I've been trying out a couple of different lash serums over the past month. With my husband also using it (on his brows), while I use it on my lashes, we've been able to try different brands to see if there are any differences in results. This serum, by Kimuse, is very similar to the others in consistency (a thin liquid) and in how it's applied (with a very thin brush). I have had no negative reactions to the serum, and no irritation to my eyes even when I've slipped and gotten some in my eye. This serum boasts results in as little as 3-4 weeks, while most others are more conservative at 6 weeks. In the few weeks we've been using the serums, neither of us have noticed any dramatic changes as far as lash or brow growth, but I do think I'm losing fewer lashes which is a definite plus. Honestly, I'm not sure if any serum is going to provide dramatic results, but we'll continue for at least a few more weeks and see what happens while hoping for the best.Hopefully, I'll be back with exciting news!

Update: After using this, as well as other, lash growth serums for several months, I have noticed a definite improvement in the length of my lashes. I have not noticed as significant an improvement in the thickness, or volume, of my lashes, however. I believe that these types of serums do help promote growth, and I haven't been able to detect much difference between brands except that a couple of them irritated my eyes. Therefore, my conclusion is that this is helpful and the real determination of what works best will be what's most comfortable for you to use, so read the ingredients and watch for any possible allergy triggers or irritants.

title: Nice cream, gimmicky packaging
text:
When I opened this package, I had no idea what I was looking at. Inside the Amazon packaging bag was another bag, a plastic bag with a bubble wrap lining and a ziplock type zipper. Inside that, was what looked like a syringe. Honestly, I was at first convinced I had the wrong order as I had no recollection of ordering anything matching what I was seeing. Upon further investigation, I discovered it was the Play Pretend brand of under eye cream. Yes, the Amazon product page does state the the cream comes in a syringe-like tube, and yes, it does state that it comes with a skincare travel bag, this wasn't what I had envisioned.
On to the product…
Once I figured out how to open and operate the syringe (hint: remove the large, clear cap, remove the white tip, turn the plunger to unlock) to dispense the under eye cream, I applied some to my face. The scent is strong, like cucumber with an underlying perfume smell. Not unpleasant, but kind of strong for me, someone who is overly sensitive to scents. My problem, I know, and most people will probably really enjoy the scent. The cream is white, smooth, goes on evenly and is absorbed quickly. There is a bit of a cooling sensation which I found pleasant.

The travel bag seems unnecessary to me. It's really not much more than a heavy ziplock bag lined with bubble wrap with a large logo reading “Skin Set Go.” If someone needs a bag, great, but I have several and I don't think I'll be using this one.

According to the company's website, Skin Care Go products are made in the USA in small batches. Good. A lot of natural ingredients go into the product, which I like, but the complete list of ingredients from the company's website is as follows:

Water (Aqua), Carthamus Tinctorius Seed Oil, Polyacrylate-13, Glycerin, Propylene Glycol, Polyisobutene, Squalane, Sodium Hyaluronate, Acetyl Hexapeptide-8, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Fruit Extract, Retinyl Palmitate, Tocopherol, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Butylene Glycol, Polysorbate 20, Acetyl Octapeptide-3, Caprylyl Glycol, Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Fragrance, Yellow 5 (CI 19140), Blue 1 (CI 42090).

The final verdict:
The product is nice, and while I'd personally prefer something less heavily scented, I like the way the cream works and what it does for my skin. It's very hydrating and brightening, with nothing that irritated my skin. I understand the idea behind the syringe dispenser: it's unique, it's fun, it's memorable. However, there's a ton of plastic used that isn't necessary, and with the design, I don't know how I'll know when the tube is nearing empty.
Overall, this is a good product, does what it says it does, and if you're looking for something a little unusual, give it a try.

title: Wonderful!
text:
This is a thick, rich cream that, for me, has worked wonders on dry, scaly skin. My hands needed some serious help and after using this cream for just a few days, I have seen much improvement. My skin is much soft, the cracks are disappearing, and they feel moisturized. The cream is thick, a little goes a long way, and I've found it's best to really rub it in, not list skim it over the skin and leave it. I have also been using the cream on a particularly itchy patch of skin on my back, again, with excellent results.
There is no scent.
The cream is made from several natural ingredients, most notably Manuka honey from New Zealand, something new to me, but that has been used for centuries in New Zealand. I'm glad it made its way to me in the USA!

title: Soft and comfortable
text: This pillow is soft and comfy and makes for a relaxing bath. I love the soft fabric that covers the pillow, such an improvement over the plastic pillow I had been using. With six suction cups, it stays in place in my free-standing tub, and it's just the right size to cradle my head and also cushion my upper back. There is an attached hook to hang the pillow to dry when done bathing. Included with the pillow are a tool to loosen the suction cups from the tub, a storage bag, and a bag of rose petals for your first bath with the new pillow. A very nice pillow!

title: Squeaky clean with silicone brush
text:
I like the silicone brush, it's soft and scrubs without scratching. I wish it comes off, was kinda weird holding the whole bottle to scrub my face.
The cleanser looks and smells like unscented liquid soap. It is like cleaning my face with foaming hand soap. It left it squeaky clean, which is nice. Takes away all the excess oil and grime and makeup. My skin felt tight afterwards.
I don't know about the hydrating part as I always follow washing my face with aloe Vera gel. I have oily, sensitive skin and this didn't make me breakout.

title: Clean feeling
text: Smells very mildly of ginger, I smell soap more than anything.  I followed directions and leave it on for 10 minutes before I step in the shower.  The way I use it is to leave it on the sink counter.  I lather it on specific areas and leave it on while I brush my teeth and do other morning routines.  It feels like a clean bar of soap.  After a week, no noticeable slimming, but those areas feel clean and less bloated.

title: Leaves slight oily sheen
text: It is cooling on the skin when I apply it.  Smells like winter mint gum.  Takes a lot of rubbing for it to fully absorb and leaves a slightly oily sheen on my skin.

title: Cleans well, use repeatedly to remove blackheads
text:
The kit comes with a spatula which makes it easy to spread the mask, mine broke during the first use. I waited 30 minutes to let it dry. It peeled off like charred paper stuck to my skin. My face felt very clean and smooth, though it didn't remove all the blackheads after one use. The aloe gel felt refreshing on my skin.
Overall, a nice kit for facial cleansing.

title: Many 2" stencils, color doesn't apply well
text:
It comes with 24 different stencils (you'll have to flip the same stencil over for left/right eyebrows), which are for eyebrows that are a little over 2 inches in length. I tried a few that are close to my eyebrow shape and thickness (or thinness), but my eyebrows are a little too weird and short.
It took quite a bit of effort to transfer the color from the tube to my brows/skin. The end result is okay.
It comes with a double ended brush to help with applying and fixing the color and shape, so that helps.

title: reduces feeling of puffiness
text:
I don't think there are any creams that would make eyebags disappear. I just look for ones that would reduce the feeling of puffiness. For that, I'd give this 5 stars. But it does not reduce wrinkles, eyebags, etc., which is what it claims, so I gave it 3 stars.
I use it in the morning and in the evening, after washing my face.
It feels cool when applied, and doesn't cause any irritation. It also doesn't give me eye crusts. There is no smell. It doesn't have any bad interaction with my makeup either.

title: good idea, so-so-execution
text: Good idea but execution seems a bit off -  after about 3 weeks, the pumice stone came off the handle  and the loofah has lost its shape.  But the brushes and the handle work great and is holding its shape and functionality very well.  A over-the-top note is included in the set - so be aware if this is being gifted.

title: Sheds quite a bit and is too big
text: I ordered this wig, and I am a bit disappointed. The wig sheds quite a bit, feels a bit thinner than the 180% density it promises, and the wig fits people with much bigger heads. The wig does come with the knots already bleached, and it is as long as it stated, but overall this wig just isn't worth the money. I would skip it and wouldn't order again.

title: NOT WATER BASED
text: Where to start? This set is not water based,  excepting the two glitter gels. Nothing was labeled,  the oil based makeups melted in the package,  the temporary tattoos didn't transfer cleanly,  the stencils were just stickers that didn't stay in place,  and in all,  this product was very disappointing. The only two upsides were the brushes included that were of good quality and the glitter gels that, while covering very thinly, shimmered nicely.  Just don't expect to apply thickly because it just won't happen.  I'd skip this kit.

title: Long lasting
text:
These khaki brown neutral shadows are a good addition to my makeup palette. My favorite feature of this 6 piece cream eye shadow is that it stays put even when I am sweating. Instead of streaking down my cheeks or blotching in the creases of my eyelids, it really stays on where it is supposed to, especially if I use an eyeshadow primer. The colors are lovely, neutral hues that most people will find complementary to their skin tone. I have a couple of their eye shadow sets, but this is the one that gets used the most.

The pink set is softly feminine with lighter colors to accent daywear. They are perfect for cooler skin tones or as highlights on the eye for warmer tones.

title: Good charcoal mask
text: The mask goes on easily with the spatula and dries with a more matte finish to show when it is ready. I could feel it tightening as it dried. It peels off easily where enough is applied, but tends to leave behind the edges, like most of these types of masks do. I like the serum that comes after. I used the mask after taking a hot bath and washing with my regular cleanser to help open the pores, soften any blackheads, and loosen the dead skin. It works well, drying in about 20 minutes. It left my skin feeling soft. I then finished with the serum and enjoyed the selfcare it promotes. A nice addition to my routine.

title: doesn't make a huge difference in my routine
text: I used this immediately after showering, two pumps, as stated on the box. Which happens to be in Japanese, so I've added translations for anyone interested. It's good, definitely removes any tight feeling from the skin after a shower or cleansing, but I don't find it to give me any wow factor in my skincare routine. Just another step. It's very lightweight, no artificial scent, and soaks right in.

title: space spacing, but the "massaging" things hurt/tickle
text:
Love having a space saving tub to soak my feet in. I deal with achy feet at the end of the day due to a hammertoe LOL. Man, y'all just get all the juicy details about my most intimate secrets huh!?

Anyway, if you stand on the massagers, OUCH. If you rub your feet back and forth along them, hee hee *Michael Jackson voice* that tickles. Maybe one day I'll be able to have a nice jet powered bubbly one.. are you reading this, my sweet soon to be hubby? Til then.. this will do the job! Plus it came with a pumice and file! Love love love. PS I have wide feet. Size 8. Lots of room..

title: WHY DIDN'T I GET THIS SOONER?!
text:
Oh my GAWWWD! This thing is amazing! This will be a lengthy review, but if you are like me, I hope you'll enjoy the very detailed essay I am about to write for the 2nd time because my original review closed out of the page :(

I will preface this by letting you know I have coarse, curly hair. "bUt hEaThEr, wHat nUmBer aNd pOroSitY aRe YoU?".
I am 3a-c and high porosity. Now, it is storytime LOL, so grab a snack or an adult bev.

Let me tell you about the root, no pun intended, of a good portion of my self esteem issues LOL. When I was a kid, I was teased relentlessly about my hair. Ah yes, even Rave/LA Looks gel, with a spritz of White Rain hairspray couldn't tame this! Kids are mean. I ran cross country all through high school, and with many mornings having only an hour to get ready after running until my bunions ached (what the heck heather, TMI!), I eventually learned the only way to keep these people from throwing tiny paper balls in my hair or touching it, was to throw it in a bun. Containment, if you will. That thing was so tight I could hardly think straight. Does that explain my grades lol? So, my hair means a lot to me, y'all!

Moving onto the stuff you really want to know, the magical brush I'm in love with💖

This brush has what I assume are nylon bristles. The only suggestion I have is to replace them with boar bristles, but it isn't a deal breaker. A few, and I mean 2 or 3, of those bristles came out when I was examining this baby before using it. It has pins and bristles all the way around and up and down. They don't tug at the hair or stretch it to damage or snap damp hair. I did brush my hair out with a wet brush before using, though.

The brush is so lightweight, I didn't think it was going to do much lol. Thank you to the manufacturer for making it so lightweight! It was such a breeze to brush the sections of hair. My wrists were happy :)

The brush does get hot, but not too hot! I accidentally touched the metal part a few times and I still have all my fingers! Yeehaw! There is a little knob that sticks out, to grasp onto as you roll the brush through your hair. You could probably use a straightening glove too! I have never used a Revlon brush, nor touched one irl. So, take that for what it is, but I've watched A LOT of videos on YouTube with that specific brush. I believe the Revlon is heavier and hotter than this brush. I have heard of some gals smelling burning. I did not experience that. I did use a heat protectant (up to 450°) along with a leave in cream. By the way, there is an air (I assume cool) setting, which is amazing as it is actually regar air! Not semi warm air like some dryers I've used in the past. The low setting is low and the high is faster and hotter. They light up so you know what is what! Love it.

Please don't expect this to smooth it out like a flat iron would. This provides the perfect base though, to smooth with a flat iron quickly. It took me from start to finish about 50 mins. Some of that time was spent sectioning and spraying the hair with protectant, as well as doing some house stuff. Realistically it maybe took 40 mins. I did wait after my wash and condition, to let the hair dry a little bit. To about 85%. I even spritzed dry sections with water as needed, so my brush could glide through. I've only used this 2x. Once on wet hair and once for a touch up. I'm hoping to be as good as Julissa Guillen on YouTube, as I use this more :) maybe I'll be faster and it'll be smoother too!

I used this before bedtime, so I don't have a day of wear pics available for you.

But, the second pic shows my hair wet, unbrushed.

The third pic is right after finishing! AMAZING! I was literally in awe! Couldn't believe it. Even after cosmetology school, I couldn't master a blowout on myself *cries*

The fourth pic is the next morning. Slept on a regular cotton pillowcase (I should get a satin one from Amazon lol). I left it down while I slept btw.

The last pic is after a go through with the flat iron. I didn't have to section my hair for once to flat iron my hair! I just ran it through with some more heat protectant as well, a must have :D

Besides the boar bristle suggestion, I did notice the words on the dryer are already faded. It doesn't affect the dryer, so I really don't care lol. The other thing was the twisty thing to turn the dryer on, doesn't line up directly with the lights and words (OFF, AIR, LOW, HIGH). Again, I don't care but everyone different, so I wanted to let you beautiful awesome people know!

Overall, I am so impressed and so upset at myself for not getting one of these sooner. Can't beat the value and it comes with a warranty. Thank you HAUSBELL, I LOVE YOU!❣💞🥰💇‍♀️
