title: Great design!!!
text: These silicon brackets were the best product I ever purchased. It has made breathing so much easy while wearing masks. I normally wear glasses so whenever I wear a mask it always fogs with my glasses esp when it's cold outside. After putting these on I am finally able to breathe and not worry about the way the fabric touches my face when I am walking outside and no fogs in my glasses. The brackets were lightweight and comfortable to wear,great buy in these difficult times.

title: Good addition to the collection
text: I bought this piece specifically for the summer months and I've always been fond of blonde hair, but didn't think I would like it as much as I do. It is so cute on me, very stylish, affordable and breathable. It doesn't ever feel heavy or look awkward; I just throw it on and go. I've worn this piece to bed many times. Get up and brush out the kinks, looks good as new. For synthetic hair, this one is hard to beat. I love changing up my look so this piece will be retired in a few days, but I loved this wig so much that I wore it for two weeks in a row & I honestly can't remember the last time I did that with a synthetic piece & it STILL looks as good as it did on the first day. Go ahead and buy it.

title: Great design, improve back?
text: This is the best clipper I've ever had and now that my hands aren't as agile as they once were, perfect!  The handle is thicker than standard and textured w/3 indented slots; has indented area where thumb fits comfortably; is not the shiny stainless steel that is so slippery.  Now the back part/bottom is the shiny steel...I think they should have made it textured too, to ease slipperiness! The actual clipper cutting edge is the smile shape ).  The back also has a "keyhole" for hanging it if you wanted.  Great little file w/nicely plumped end for ease of use.  A "nail catcher"..meaning a black tough cover that when not in use snaps on to the clipper.  All this comes in a handy little black case

title: Great relief for my dry winter skin
text: Winter is starting to wear down but I still have super dry skin from having the heat on in the house so I got this to try to at least hydrate my skin.  It came packaged just fine without any defects.  To use you first have to unscrew the cap and pull some foil out but then it's good to go.  I put a bit on my arms and they instantly felt a ton better.  It has a nice floral smell that isn't overpowering. It goes on pretty easily and works to keep my skin hydrated.

title: Works well and keeps cold
text: My wife had been wanting one of these for a bit so I decided to get this for her to try out.  It came packaged well with no defects.  In the box were just the ice roller and the instructions.  You put it in your freezer till it freezes (we left it in overnight). The roll is smooth and very very cold.  It is made of plastic but it doesn't feel like cheap plastic so as long as you are careful it seems like it will last.  All in all, she is happy with it so I am too.

title: Great for shaving nicks
text: I have started shaving with a safety razor and well I'm still learning it so I have had a few nicks and cuts.  I got this so I could stop the bleeding from nicks.  It comes with a decent amount that I am able to fit in a tin I keep next to my other shave gear and has stopped the bleeding from the nicks I have.  I like it more than the styptic sticks I have used in the past.

title: Different than what I'm used too but in a good way
text: I got this because I was intrigued by how they could improve on the old spray version of breath spray.  It comes in two pieces on the base which is where the battery, controls, and charging port is, and a pod for your flavor.  It has a USB c charging port which I really enjoy and seemed to charge in a decent amount of time.  I got the extra mint flavor and it tastes fine.  The thing I was not ready for is instead of spraying it comes out like a vapor.  I don't know if they would render the spray versions moot but it is nice with a good flavor.

title: Just as described
text: I suffer from dry skin and usually soak my feet nightly. This is a great little foot bath that is collapsible and easy to store! The tools that came with I could have done without but the bath itself is great

title: You'll need more than 20pcs as they are thin
text: Good quality real human hair. Easy to put on. I washed my hair, “sandwich” the extensions, and then used the flat iron just for a second to melt the glue and to blend the extensions better with my natural hair. I've got a blonde color T18/60 + 60# in size 16 inches. The hair color doesn't match my natural hair 100%, but it doesn't look bad when the hair is blended. Please note that there's not much hair in the package (20pcs but the hair is thin) so you'll need more than one pack.

title: Good nail drill, not cordless though
text: I like this nail drill. It's basic, it's simple, easy to hold while working. It comes with a cord, 11 tips for different purposes and 50 polishing rings. There is a manual which describes different tips which is helpful for beginners. You can cut/grind/sculpt/polish your nails and even cut the cuticle. This is not the most powerful device on the market but it does the job. If you are looking for a drill to work specifically on acrylic or other artificial application nails (or nail removals) please consider getting a more powerful devise. Please note that this is not portable cordless nail drill and in order for it to work you'll have to use the cord and plug it in.

title: Thankyou.. Superb Quality
text: Fast Delivery- Stellar Customer Service.. Much appreciated..

title: Best Quality
text: This is real and pure Organic Beeswax.. I was taken aback of the high quality compared to the rest I tried.. Im sticking w this thankyou!

title: Not impressed
text: Oh my, where to begin? No instructions. No way you can put this on the corner of the wall since it doesn't bend. The cutout notch isn't big enough, so it doesn't sit flush on a wall corner. Catnip is included but no idea where to put it since there aren't any instructions. There's holes in the back. Does catnip go there or is that for screwing it into the wall? My cats were not interested in this.

title: High quality warm headband
text: New Balance is a popular brand in our home. My husband & sons wear NB shoes because they're so comfortable. The same quality applies to this headband. It has a good stretch to fit larger heads, the seams are sewn in tight & neatly, and the material is soft. Another great product from New Balance!

title: Great all around wipe
text:
Honest reviews matter, good or bad, so here's my thoughts...

Pros: soft on your skin, but strong - I've rinsed & reused them; use your own product vs. pre-moistened wipes; use to clean your face, bathroom, kitchen, etc.
Cons: absolutely none!

title: Good quality, two in a pack! not for big hair
text: I was excited when I opened up the package because I didn't realize it came with two. These are cute shower caps with a great texture that isn't like others I've used, though I can't describe it. Unfortunately, this didn't fit over my hair (too much hair!) so I wouldn't buy this again unless it came in other sizes. Still, I used it in the shower and it did a great job of keeping the hair that it did cover, dry. Also, it seems like it, somehow, isn't a soaking mess once you come out of the shower. Good shower cap if you have thinner hair or hair that's styled in a flat way.

title: Not a fan at all
text: Not very lightweight. This stuff was thick and not easy to use. because it was so thick it was not natural looking at all. I am not satisfied with this and wont be using.

title: Cute
text: Cute colors my toddlers gets to pick the colors she wants when we get our hair done. It's has a good stretch, great for my baby's afro hair. Excellent price point

title: Very hydrating
text: Great moisturizer. It goes on light and doesn't make my skin feel sticky, It absorbs quickly leaving my skin hydrated, it's also good for the summer

title: I really like this face moisturizer
text: Exactly product I must say, I have dry skin and always In search of a light weight hydrating face moisturizer. And am glad I tried this, it's not sticky and very hydrating. Down side for me is, it's very pricey. But I definitely recommend It, would be nice to have some discount on.

title: Using it every day it's an excellent product
text: I can't tell you how much this have been helping my little ones eczema that itches all day behind the legs..... once I rub it on the spot the skin is immediately hydrated, stop itching. The scaring and rough skin is also clearing. Am really happy using this product. And I will definitely buy more. I also it on my edges too and I have noticed growth.

title: I want to like it but I cannot
text: So I thought this will be nice for my 4c hair but  no. So I used it on my wigs and I didn't really like the results. Its definitely not for my hair type.

title: Works good
text:
I tested this out on my pugs the day it arrived. I first tested to make sure they didn't fight me too much when I stuck their feet inside of the cup. They didn't. So, I filled with warm water, stuck their foot inside, turned the cup, then pulled their feet out to dry.
Seemed to work good. I just want to be able to rinse their feet of any dirt, sand, pebbles, or anything else that gets stuck in their pads.
I like that it has a small handle so I can hook it up near the back door.

title: Skin is softer
text:
Not sure about the calming or soothing effects this is suppose to give my skin. But, my skin is feeling a lot softer after using this for 4 days now.
Easy to open and use. Just place rubber piece, that's included, over the top of a glass ample. Holding onto the rubber piece, bend and snap the glass top off. Turn the rubber top upside down to discard the piece of glass top.
Then pour liquid onto your palm and apply to face and neck. Absorbs within a few mins.

title: smells nice
text:
I want to use this spray on the bedding. All the bedding. Makes it smell so nice for when we all go to bed. Just a nice fresh scent.
I can't really pick out a particular scent with this spray. It's a nice combination though.
With spring here and the windows open again, we're all loving having a nice fresh scent in our bedrooms and our beds using this spray.

title: So many stencils
text:
I really love having so many stencils to choose from. When I found a couple I really liked, I numbered them so I'll remember which ones I like.
The powder is messy. Have to be so careful not to get any on myself because it will stain.
The color is nice for my brown/gray hair.
It takes a bit of trial and error when first using this kit. Not to dab too hard to have the powder go on way too dark. Finding the right stencil that fits my face.
I did a lot of scrubbing until I finally got the combination down. So far the color has lasted about 3 days. I'll use a brush to fine tune them a little.
Love having actual eyebrows again.

title: How to open?
text:
Looking at the design of the case this is in, it looks like the smaller part of the top should open. If it is suppose to open, I can't figure it out. So, I just unscrewed the entire top off to use it. Not really a big issue.
The foundation itself is waterproof. Does last all day with no problem.
It's a nice smooth foundation. Easy to apply with the sponge that comes with this.
It does cover up some of the skin flaws.
It's an okay foundation for a decent price. Kept my skin soft all day.
Was easy enough to wash off at the end of the day. I would buy again.

title: Nice and compact
text:
I like the size of this. It's nice and small so it's easy to keep in my purse for when I need it.
Easy to use. Just roll on my face and it absorbs any oils without messing up my makeup.
Does come with a second ball.
Not sure how long the one ball will last since I just started using it. Seems that it would last quite a long time.

title: It's just okay
text:
I don't like the pump of this wash. It's so small that it takes so many pumps to get a small amount. I finally gave up and just poured it out of the bottle.
Scent....Not the greatest. It doesn't last long which is nice because it's not a scent I want to smell like when I get out of the shower.
Did lather nice. Rinsed off and I felt clean.
Maybe men would like this better than women. And some may like how it smells. Just not a scent for me.

title: Nice machine
text:
After using different tattoo machines, this one is more just for beginners.
It's light and easy to use. Kit comes with almost everything needed to start practicing.
I wanted to see how good this machine would do with lines. It's okay but, the machine does get a bit on the warm side after having it run for about 60-90 mins.
All in all this kit is nice.

title: Nice Laser Removal Tool
text:
I'll say it, I hate shaving. The older I get the more hair I get on my upper lip. Horrible.
So I am now trying this laser tool to see if it'll help with at least most of my unwanted hair.
I haven't been using it long. I clean and then I shave the areas that I want to laser treat.
I would say that after about 3 weeks/3 times a week, you'll see at least a little difference if not a big difference.
The device is easy to hold in one hand.
Says that it will last my lifetime. And it probably will. The most I'll be using it is the first month or two. After that I expect only maintenance use.
No counter to count down the number of used flashes. But it's okay. Not a big deal.
It does have to be plugged in. Again, not an issue. I only have it out, while using it, for about 10 mins tops. Takes me 2 seconds to plug it in.
Love having this. Anything that makes a day go a bit easier is okay with me.

title: Nice variety
text:
It's so hard to find good tweezers that actually grab the hair. These tweezers seem to work nicely.
I tried 3 of them so far and I have no complaints.
The case is nice to keep them all organized and easy to find. The eyebrow brush was a nice addition to this set.
The curved scissors work great also.
Glad to have this set in my collection. Will make it so much easier when I need to do a bit of face grooming.

title: Quick and easy facial cleaning in no time
text:
Fantastic facial cleaning brush. I like that it has a pretty case to use if I ever travel with it. You can store the other brushes (comes with 3. One for massage, one for sensitive skin and one normal brush)
Great that the battery holds a charge for about 30 uses. Nice feature for when I'm on the road and don't want to bother with the charger at every hotel.
Has 3 speeds so you can decide on how much brushing you want on your face.
My face feels so clean after I'm done using it. I put on some night cream, with the massage brush, afterwards and my face is so smooth. I love it.
I'm also wondering how difficult it will be to find replacement brush heads.

title: Don't like minty smell.
text: It does make my hair soft but, I can't take the minty smell it has!  I use Pantene products all the time and was shocked when I was in the shower and put this conditioner on my head.  I stopped and looked at the bottle to see what exactly I was using. Doesn't smell nice like the other Pantene Conditioners I've used.  Going to have to put this bottle under my cabinet to use only when I'm desperate. Will go back to the other Pantene conditioners. And I will always open and smell any new shampoo or conditioner I buy.

title: Doesn't work on coarse facial hair
text:
I got this product hoping it would help with my super coarse facial hair (I'm a woman). It doesn't, but that isn't the product's fault. I read online that really coarse hair has to be pretty long (like half an inch long!) for waxing to be effective, and who would want to let their facial hair grow like that? Not me!

It works for other types of hair, though. I was able to wax my legs. The temperature control is reassuring (no worries about burns), and the roll on applicator is way less messy than sticks in a pot. It comes with plenty of supplies, too. So, even though I didn't get my wish, I think this kit is a good one.

title: As effective as other brands; bit harder to peel off the backing; wasteful packaging
text:
These patches work as well as other patches I've tried. They are not a miraculous cure-all, but they do help flatten out the acne and draw out the stuff that needs to be drawn out (don't want to get too gross and graphic here). They are small (1 cm diameter) so the coverage is limited, but they adhere well.

There are a couple of cons with these that lower my score:

> They are harder to peel off the backing than others, and it's easy to fold over the edge of the patch when removing it, making it less effective. Other brands I've used have slits in the backing material, making it much easier to dispense a patch without damaging it.

> The packaging is very wasteful. Each sheet of 20 comes in its own box. You could easily fit several sheets into one box. Either the box should be made much smaller or each box should hold multiple sheets. There's no need for all this packaging waste.

Three stars (average). While these work as well as other patches, there are other options that are better choices.

title: Good performance; no scent; slow to absorb
text:
This is a pretty good cream for dealing with ultra dry, cracked skin. I've used it with good results on my elbows -- it softens, soothes and helps with healing. There's only a small hint of a scent to it that is only noticeable if you smell the cream in the jar. Once it's applied there's no scent that I can detect, which is a major plus.

It's a soft cream that's easy to dispense and spread. That's also a plus since other intensive moisturizing creams I've tried tend to be more solid and harder to use. This has more of a whipped cream type of consistency that's easy to work with.

It does take time to soak in, and my skin remains greasy feeling for a while after using it. It's not a significant problem for elbows, knees, feet, etc., but is a issue when using it on my hands. The greasy feeling makes it not a great hand cream other than at night.

Not perfect, but a better than average intensive moisturizing cream. A solid 4 stars.

title: Nice compact size, but too little witch hazel to be of significant benefit
text:
This are mini wipes, with each measuring about 5.25 by 4.25 inches. They are packaged very compactly, making them easy to take along in a gym bag, backpack or even in your pocket. The packet is soft, which means it's not ideal for dispensing one wipe at a time without some measure of struggle. There's an adhesive flap to cover the opening, but again, as with pretty much any packet with this design, the flap doesn't do nearly as good of a job as a hard plastic cover.

The wipe material is soft but pretty durable. It's designed to be a "prep" before using a stick-on breathing strip on your nose. As such, it doesn't do all that good of a job. While it does contain witch hazel, there's too little of it for the wipe to perform well. Witch hazel is the last ingredient (after water, glycerin, and aloe). Witch hazel is a great prep for any adhesive to ensure a good skin bond. Using these wipes is really no better for that task than plain water.

While it is a comfortable wipe to use for general face and hand cleaning, given the price and the lack of unique benefits re: better adhesion, I see this as a 3 star (average) product at best. It's not something I'd get again.

title: Excellent performance; enjoyable scent; very little needed per use
text:
I'm very pleased with this face cleaner. It is a medium thick consistency that has a creamy texture. It lathers a bit slowly at first, but builds up a nice, thick lather after a few moments. Not much is needed per use -- just a dab will get the job done. It cleans very well but doesn't leave my face dry. I've had zero irritation from it even though it's a good, deep cleaner.

The scent is very enjoyable. It's a light floral/fruity scent that is unique. It is not overpowering, and doesn't linger after rinsing.

The tube comes nicely packaged for protection during transit. It's in a reinforced box cardboard box that is shrink wrapped. Even if it's sent in a padded envelope there's very little risk of the tube leaking in transit.

No complaints at all. It works very well, has an enjoyable, unique scent, is packaged well, and since so little is needed per use, the value is pretty good. Five stars!

title: Very good performance and an excellent scent
text:
I'm very pleased with all aspects of this face wash. It's a medium consistency that dispenses easily. The pump mechanism works well to output just a small amount at a time which is a plus since not much is needed per use. It lathers readily and does an excellent job of cleaning. My face feels tight after using it but in a good way -- a clean tightness rather than a dried out tightness.

The scent is excellent. It's a woodsy type of scent that is different and very enjoyable. The scent does not linger after use (which is a shame since it is such a nice smell).

It's pricey per ounce, but considering how little is needed for good results, the cost per use is not bad at all. Plus the scent is so unique that, for me, it's worth the extra amount. Five stars!

title: Good scrubbing performance; nice light scent
text:
I'm pleased with this face scrub. It hits the right middle ground: not so coarse that you feel as if you're rubbing gravel on your face, but not so fine that there's no scrub action. This provides a good amount of scrubbing but not to the point where it's irritating. It's a medium thick cream consistency that spreads easily. Not much is needed per use.

The scent is fairly mild and while you can pick out the eucalyptus scent it's not so strong to be overwhelming, as eucalyptus can sometimes get. The scent does not linger after rinsing.

Checks all the right boxes for me for a face scrub. Five stars.

title: Unusual soap, but works well
text:
I've not come across a face soap in this format -- it's a stick format, much like an antiperspirant. You rub the stick on your dry face, then use water. It's different but very easy to get used to quickly.

The soap doesn't lather all that much but it does do a good job of cleaning without drying out my face. The scent is quite nice, with the eucalyptus coming through the most. It's a medium/mild level of scent that is noticeable without being overwhelming. The scent does not linger after rinsing. The soap itself is black due to the inclusion of charcoal.

The dispensing tube is well done, with a screw base that pushes up the soap easily and evenly. It also has a screw top cover, which is a nice touch for keeping the lid affixed if you take this while traveling or use it in a gym bag.

It's an unusual but enjoyable twist on face soap. A bit pricey for the amount you get, but it's sufficiently unique to justify the cost, in my opinion. Five stars.

title: Some nice items, but disappointing quality for toenail clippers
text:
This is a comprehensive set of nail cutting/trimming/maintaining tools. The standard clipper is very nice -- solid, sharp, and well up to the task of handling fingernails and lighter toenails. The various tools are also of decent quality.

What's not so good is the toenail clippers. It has a rather lightweight feel to it compared with other clippers I've used. The short handles make it less comfortable to use than other clippers. More importantly, the spring mechanism failed within the first couple of minutes of use. It uses two leaf style springs that push the jaws apart. The problem is with how they attach to the handle. There are two little prongs for each spring that fit into two little holes in the handle. For mine, the pins are too short to make a solid connection, so one falls (or rather, jumps) out no matter how many times I've tried to seat it properly into the handle (see photo). It can be used without the spring, but it's quite cumbersome to do so. Given the importance of the toenail clipper to the overall usefulness of the kit, I see this as a 2 star product.

If the springs were better it would be 4 stars since, even when properly functioning, the clippers are not as easy to use as others, but warrant 4 stars given the low cost compared with better quality clippers.

title: Proven ingredients, but a poor value
text:
I'm not all that impressed with these products. Neither container lists the ingredients on the label, instead providing the ingredient list on a card that's in the box. It shows that the cleaner is a 2% salicylic acid wash, which is a pretty tried and true formulation for treating acne. It is a low-lather, but still effective cleaner, but I didn't experience any difference with this compared with other 2% salicylic cleaners that cost far less. It's a fine cleaner, but way overpriced for such a tiny (0.51 oz) container.

The repairing night cream is a combination of retinol (0.05%), niacinamide (3%), and hyaluronic acid (2%). All are proven performers, but again, it's quite overpriced considering how low of a percentage of retinol is in the formulation. It does a decent job of moisturizing and did not cause any skin irritation. I am a fan of retinol, but the concentration in this cream (0.05%) is well below what I usually use (either 0.1% or 0.5%).

While this product combo is on the right track, the value is just not there considering the amount in the container (one-half an ounce for each). While I would certainly recommend a salicylic acid wash and a retinol-based cream, there are many other options that provide these options at a far lower cost. Four stars for performance; 1 star for value; overall rating of 2.5 stars.

title: Beautiful cobalt blue bottles; great caps; so-so sprayers
text:
I love the look of these bottles. They are cobalt blue, and really stand out from the usual amber tints. The bottle itself is well-made and sturdy. The included caps (2 were provided) are of excellent quality, with polycone inserts to maintain an air-tight, leak proof seal. The included sprayers (2 were provided) are functional, but rather cheap in terms of build quality, especially the trigger. It also comes with a tiny little funnel that is way undersized and pretty useless given the bottle volume, and a few black labels (which require a white pen, which is NOT included).

Each bottle comes in a bubble pack sleeve, but the box itself is rather thin with limited protection. These are a notch below other bottles I've received when it comes to manufacturer-provided protective packing. Still, the bottles did not break or chip in transit.

The bottles needed a good wash before use since the outside had some type of greasy-feeling film. I would have washed them regardless of their condition, but these definitely needed a good washing before use.

Taking everything into consideration I'll rate these as 4 stars. Well worth considering if you need a more colorful option than amber and don't expect to be using the sprayer much (or at all).

title: Pleasant scent; very gentle; not all that effective for cleaning
text:
There are a number of positive features of this face wash. I love the scent -- it's a light, "fresh" scent that is sort of floral and sort of botanical. Normally I prefer unscented (or something that just smells soapy) but this light scent is quite enjoyable. It's a thick cream that resembles a moisturizer more so than a soap.

There's virtually no lather to it. It foams up a bit, but very lightly. It's a very gentle soap but, for me, it's a bit too gentle in that I don't have a clean feeling after using it. My face feels more like I've applied a moisturizer. That's not a bad thing, especially in the dry winter months, but I want to have a clean-feeling face after using a face soap, and I don't get it from this.

Balancing the positive and negative features puts my rating at three stars (average). It smell great and it is very gentle, but it's not a face soap I'd get again. There are other gentle soaps that also offer better cleaning and a better value on a cost per ounce basis.

title: Excellent quality; useful accessories; good protection
text:
I'm impressed with how well these glass bottles are packaged by the manufacturer. Each bottle is double-packed in bubble pack, and all accessories are wrapped up so they can't move around and damage the glass bottles. Even though the shipping box was beat up, the bottles were all 100% fine.

The glass is of good quality in terms of thickness, and quite sturdy (as far as glass can be, however). The brown tinting is excellent for UV protection of the contents. The accessories are mostly useful items, with the best ones being the caps and the funnel. The caps have an insert to provide an excellent seal, which is key to maintaining content freshness. They also come with spray heads that, while functional, are rather lightweight in terms of build quality.

All in all, an excellent set of bottles that are packaged very well, and come with some very useful extras. Very pleased!

title: Very good quality; useful extras
text:
I'm very pleased with these glass bottles. The glass is thick and, while it's certainly not immune to breaking, it can deal with the occasional bump without a problem. Having it be tinted brown is great for limiting the amount of UV that can enter, plus gives it a nice look. The caps are excellent and provide a good seal. The sprayers are just OK. They work, but are not all that heavy-duty. I'm using these more for storage than application, so I'm more interested in the cap seal than the sprayer.

It also comes with a very useful funnel, a dropper and a white marker. The funnel is something that I'll use often; I won't use the others. But, it's a nice complement of accessories.

The bottles come very well packaged with two layers of bubble pack, and are in a box that's the right size to prevent things from moving around. They arrived in perfect shape even though they were shipped in a non-padded ship bag.

Very pleased with the set -- 5 stars!

title: Excellent lather, performance and scent; fussy bottle
text:
I'm impressed with this face soap. It's very thick and silky, and only a very small amount is needed to get good results. That's especially welcome to find out given the price for a pretty small bottle. It lathers up well and does a good job of cleaning without leaving my skin overly dry. It is a bit more intensive than other face soaps, so my face does feel a little 'tight' after using it. However, it's not excessive, and well worth it given how well this soap cleans if you have an oily complexation. The charcoal makes the soap dark, but it's not as jet-black as other charcoal soaps I've used. It's more of a deep gray.

The scent is also quite nice. It's a medium/light intensity and has sort of an after-shave smell to it. The scent does not linger much at all after rinsing. While I tend to prefer unscented soaps, this scent is pleasant and enjoyable.

The only con is the bottle. Getting the pump nozzle to pop up was a chore since the retaining ring the pump head screws into also rotates, making it a struggle to get the nozzle to pop up. I eventually got it working, but have noticed that the pump leaks at the stem. It's a small leak, but it adds up over a few days to make a mess on the bottle and waste soap. Given the price, the pump mechanism should have been of better quality.

One star down for the bottle issues, but otherwise, it's a very enjoyable soap to use.

title: Nice compact size, but very cheap construction
text:
I like the small, compact size of these spray bottles. The height makes them easy to stow in a cabinet without taking up much room at all. Of course, a small size means small capacity, but for my needs that's a perfectly fine trade-off.

What's not so good is the overall build quality. The bottles are made of thin plastic that look and feel cheap. The trigger action on the sprayers is not smooth or reliable. The sprayer hose detaches easily.

Given the price, these are 2 stars for value -- they look, feel and perform as a bottle you'd get in a dollar store. A shame, since it can be hard to find compact spray bottles.

title: Decently durable; easy to use; could be a bit longer
text:
These are reasonably durable mask holder bands. The "fingers" that hold the mask straps are thin, but I didn't experience any tearing even when tugging on them a lot harder than they would be exposed to in normal use. The fingers are widely spaced and can deal with flat-style elastic bands without a problem.

My only quibble is that they are a bit too short in length. While using them does increase mask comfort around my ears, they would be better if they were about an inch or so longer.

Not ideal, but a helpful aid to increase long-term mask wearing comfort especially with masks that have short ear loops.

title: Basic design, but effective; great for house guests
text:
This is a pretty basic toothbrush. It lacks the features found on more expensive toothbrushes, such as sculpted bristle patterns, but it performs just fine. The bristles are a medium/soft density which works well for me -- firm enough for good cleaning but soft enough that it doesn't cause any gum irritation. The handles are also pretty basic but the bamboo makes them more grippy than the basic plastic brushes.

The bristles are all firmly attached. None have come loose after a good amount of use. I can't say the charcoal infused bristles do anything beyond what a regular bristle does, but they look nice.

Each comes individually packed and includes a tiny tube of toothpaste. It's a great item to have on hand for situations such as house guests who forget to bring a brush, for traveling, to stow in your desk at work, etc.

No complaints. They work well, and I'm glad that it's a way to use/discard less plastic waste.

title: Nice balance between soft and firm; some fitment issues
text:
This is a good middle ground between the standard Oral-B brand brushes and the Ultra Soft Oral-B brand brushes. I find the standard brush to be a bit too firm and, while I like the softness of the Ultra Soft, sometimes I'd like just a bit more firmness to the bristles. This is a good compromise. It's softer than the standard but firmer than the Ultra Soft.

On the downside, it does not fit as well as the authentic Oral-B brushes. It's a little bit loose, which causes it to be noisier in operation than an authentic brush. It still works fine and stays on firm enough so there's no danger of it coming off in use, but there's enough play in the fit that it's more buzzy than an authentic.

Even with the fit issue, this is a decent alternative to the Oral-B brand brushes and a solid 4-star brush.

title: Nice look; feels pretty solid; but average in performance & value
text:
This is a “dressed up” version of the Wahl “LifeProof” shaver (which I also reviewed). It has a more upscale look and feel to it, plus adds a battery gauge to show the charge level. However, the shave quality is the same – OK, but not a standout.

The case feels more solid than the LifeProof and, while it's more of a traditional look, I think they did a nice job with the overall aesthetics. It is pretty grippy even with wet hands. It does not, however, feel as comfortable to hold as the more sculpted models such as most of the Panasonic shavers and some Braun shavers.

The shave quality of this model is identical to that of the LifeProof: very Remington in how it feels (close, but rather aggressive). Performance is best on the easy spots (cheek) but not as good on the more trickier spots (neck and jawline). The flex head helps with dealing with face contours but it lacks enough travel to do an excellent quality job.

The aggressiveness of the shave is dialed down when using it wet. It needs a very, very thin layer of shave cream (the gel style creams work well) or the head gets bogged down.

Love the trimmer! The positioning could be improved to make it easier to use, but it cuts very cleanly on sideburns and ‘shash trimming.

The controls are clean, easy to read and tell you all you need to know (charge and battery status).

I like the feel of this better than the Wahl LifeProof, but the shave quality keeps this at the same rating (average, which is 3 stars). It's a very workable shaver, but for the price there are better choices available from Panasonic (anything in their Arc line) or, for less money, from Remington.

title: Truly some wonderful stuff to fight "winter hands"
text:
I hate winter for a lot of reasons, but one of them is that my hands get so dry that I get cracks at my fingertips. It's annoying and painful, especially at night. I've tried all sorts of moisturizers without much success. The best results (if you can call it that) have been from using petroleum jelly, but that's messy and it still doesn't work well.

This argan oil, however, has been hugely effective. It gave me results right from the first day, and over the course of just a few days I can see noticeable healing of the skin cracks. No more pain and my hands feel far better than any other treatment I've tried.

The product comes very nicely packaged, with a nice box filled with shredded packing material to keep the glass bottle safe in transit. It also makes for a very nice presentation should you want to give this as a gift. The bottle comes with a dropper and a “spritz” head. The latter is my only quibble – the spray head didn't work well at all, and made sort of a mess when using it to dispense the oil. I replaced it with the dropper and had much better results.

The oil itself has little or no scent. You need very, very little for results – I use about 1-2 small drops per hand, and that's more than enough. It spreads easily (as expected given that it's oil). It does take a few minutes to soak in – my hands are very greasy when I first apply it, but after a few minutes the greasiness goes away. The sheen from the oil stays around longer, but that too dissipates after 30 minutes or so.

This can be used for a wide range of applications including face, body and even hair. It comes with a good amount of information to help explain how/where to use it, and how the oil was processed.

I'm very impressed with this oil – it's the only product I've ever tried that totally worked to solve my dry/cracked hands. It's not cheap, but well worth the price if you need a highly effective moisturizer. Highly recommend.
[Sample provided for review]

title: Nice improvement
text:
This is a nice improvement to the Sonicare line of brushes. It appears to be their response to the Oral-B Floss Action line of brushes that have a "paddle" to help get between teeth. This accomplishes that goal with an plastic insert in the middle that helps direct the toothpaste between your teeth.

I use both the Sonicare (Healthy White) and the Oral B 5000. Both have their pluses and minuses, so switching between the two gives me the best of both worlds.

The Oral-B arrangement of paddles does a better job in getting at the gum line without discomfort. The Sonicare Hydroclean's bristles are stiffer and I find that they irritate my gums when used several times in a row.

But, the Sonicare does a better job in cleaning stains between teeth. I'm a tea drinker and getting the stains out between my front teeth has always been a chore. The Hydroclean works very well - noticeable improvement over the Sonicare ProResults and the Oral-B.

These only come in the standard size. The ProResults has a smaller version that is great for getting at the tight spots. But, I assume that a smaller version of this would not function well since the plastic insert would have to be very small.

If you're a ProResults user these are well worth trying out. If you have tender gums you may want to alternate between the HydroClean and the ProResults (or, as I do, with the Oral-B. The Oral-B also makes a super soft brush if you have very sensitive gums. Hard to find, but works very well).

Keep in mind that nothing takes the place of flossing. No matter what you use, you still need to break out the floss to keep your teeth healthy!

title: Nice cooling sensation
text: I have always been curious about trying some of these eye mask patches and I received two different kinds around the same time. I definitely preferred these over the other ones I received. I know it doesn't really matter, but these are so pretty. They have a shimmery gold color to them that just makes wearing them more fun. I don't suffer from eye wrinkles yet, but I do occasionally get bags under my eyes. I'm honestly not sure if I can say these get rid of the bags, but after wearing them for a little while, they definitely make my eyes feel better, which is still a win in my opinion. You get a ton of them in the container, which is great, but I feel like the container could be a little bit higher quality. It's not smooth when you close the lid–not a huge problem, but a better quality container would have made this feel even more luxurious.

title: Too much Excess Product
text: These are good, but not my favorite masks. My biggest complaint about these, which others might actually find a benefit, is that I think there is way too much product on these masks. Obviously, these kinds of masks tend to be a little messy because of the product that they are soaked in, but with these, they are just dripping. After removing the mask, the instructions say to rub in any excess product into your skin, but there's just way too much and it does not rub in. I have to blot my skin with a towel before rubbing in the excess. Other than that, the mask is nice. It feels soothing to the skin, I haven't had any reactions to it and my skin feels soft afterward.

title: Nice but 1 is a bit light on darker skin
text: These eyeshadow pens glide on very smoothly. One is a solid color and the other two have shimmer. The 03 color pen is really light. It is shimmery and you primarily only see the shimmer which is okay.

title: Smells so good!!👃
text: This lip balms smells awesome. It also did a nice job of moisturizing my lips while it was on. I do feel like after it was gone, my lips seemed a little dryer. The color had a very slight tint of pink and it had my lips glossed but not overly glossed.

title: Does not smell good to me
text: This product completely turned me off by the scent. Is decided to still try it in my hair but I did not find that it was very moisturizing either.

title: They look okay
text: These lashes are okay looking. They are not as full as I prefer. They did stick but I didn't feel they were as secure as I'd like for them to be if I'm going out the house.

title: It's a no for me
text: This is a no for me. This wig came very curly and not of an afro type. Even after combing and brushing, it was still not an afro. In other people's pictures I see that they have a real afro. Maybe I was sent to wrong wig but it is just curls and the hairs does not look long like the other wigs people have shown.

title: Curls, curls, curls!
text: This wig is full of beautiful curls!! I love this tighter curl pattern.  Once it's washed and the curls get a little more full and less uniform, it will be even more beautiful. It's so soft! I like the fit on my head. There is a comb in the back and one on each side.

title: Nice variety, seem to be durable
text:
At this price, this set is a good value in terms of quantity, variety of styles and sturdiness. I've only had them for a few days so I can't say for sure that they're going to be durable, but I did slam them repeatedly on my tile floors with far more force than with the impact of simply falling, and they're still in tact.

I have thin hair and the clips grasp nicely and wear comfortably. They open wide enough that I'm sure they'll work for thick hair, too.

The colors were a little off, at least on my monitor. The one that looks gold on my screen is actually a light tan. I will probably never wear it out of the house. It looks awful with my red hair and I can't think of many outfits it would match either. That's why the set loses a star for me. The brownish one is lighter than pictured, too.

title: Soybean Skin Conditioning Serum
text: This Soybean skin conditioning serum is a nice light unscented moisturizer. It absorbs quickly and leaves my skin soft. No heavy fragrance or dyes. Everything is in Japanese so you will need to use a translation tool to read the box. The box comes sealed so I was happy about that.

title: Great for apply massage oil
text:
This jade roller bottle has been great for applying massage oil when I use a gua sha tool on the neck and back of my spouse. It gives the right amount of oil and spreads it around nicely. The jade ball feels very comfortable when rolling it on the skin.

Note: the bottle is not sealed so any liquids inside the bottle will flow out if not kept upright.

title: Good quality comb but a little longer than a normal pocket comb
text: Good quality comb. I would not say it's a pocket comb since it's quite large. I would say this would be an excellent comb to have in a travel toiletry bag.

title: Good Castor Oil
text: I love castor oil and use a lot of it, but rarely for my hair. I've never seen or used castor oil "butter" before and I think it's very interesting. All the oils in this product are normally liquid at room temperature so I'm not sure how they got this to have a butter-like consistency. Maybe some beeswax or something was added but it's not on the list of ingredients. I really like the tea tree oil scent this castor oil butter has as tea tree is one of my favorite scents.  I think this is a very good castor oil product.

title: Looks Real
text: Very good fake beard and moustache and fun for cosplay.  It looks pretty real when on.

title: Not Very Good at Concealing
text: I've used a lot different concealers over the years but I must say that I think the Marine Forest is my least favorite.  The sticks are fat and not good for precision application, and it seems that the concealer doesn't really do a good job of concealing.  I had to go over this concealer with another concealer to cover the dark circles underneath my eyes.

title: Will Not Turn On
text: This nose hair trimmer turned on one time after charging, and has since failed to turn on.  Hubs and I both tried to get it to work, put it back on the charger to be sure,  but it's obviously malfunctioning or poorly made.  We have tossed it in the trash.

title: Good Enough
text: I have bleached blonde hair with a lot of silver mixed in.  I color it at home and if I don't use products to control brassiness my hair will start to turn kind of orangish.  I really like this shampoo.  It's nice and dark purple and lathers up really nice.  It cleans my hair well and thoroughly rinses out.  The creme rinse doesn't do much as far as conditioning or de-tangling but should help to keep hair from color warping.  It's not as dark purple as the shampoo and has no scent that I can detect.

title: Very Good Lotion
text: This is a nice set of 4, 2.53 fl. oz. tubes of moisturizing lotion.  My hands and face feel nicely hydrated and there's no annoying scent to deal with.  These are the perfect size for a purse, backpack or pocket and they seem reasonably priced.  As of this review a set of 4 only costs $14.25.

title: Excellent Sweet Almond Oil
text: I use almond oil in my handmade soaps to make them extra emollient.  It's also a wonderful moisturizer for skin and dry/damaged hair.  I think this is very good sweet almond oil, it's 100% almond oil and there's nothing negative I can find to say about it.

title: Pretty Headbands
text: These are pretty, pastel colored cloth covered headbands.  I like the scrunchie look they have.  They hold my hair out of my face very well and don't bother me much around the backs of my ears.  Sometimes head bands start to hurt my head but so far these haven't.  They're not super good quality - about a dollar each, but they do what I want them to do.

title: Good Collagen Supplement
text: If you mix up approximately 2 tablespoons (close enough to 1 and 2/3rds) you can sort of taste the berry flavor but it's basically bland and flavorless.  That's fine, you can add a flavoring to it if you want too.  As far as helping me get to sleep it doesn't.  1mg of melatonin does nothing for me.  I like that one serving delivers 10 mg of collagen but it's only one type - bovine collagen.  I think it's kind of pricey coming in at $34.95 (as of this review) since I've reviewed collagen powders that contains several types of collagen and were more than 9.3 oz for as much or even less money.  Also, you won't see any results in 2 weeks so don't let those reviews get you all excited.  I've been consuming collagen on a daily basis for about a year and am now just beginning to see some positive changes in my skin and nails.  I'm 63 and realize all the collagen supplements in the world won't make me look 40 again but I have seen some improvements in less crinkly skin on my arms and some fine lines around my eyes looking much smoother.  Collagen is not the fountain of youth but it does help if you are patient and consistent.

title: Excellent Castor Oil
text: I have used a lot of castor oil over the years but mainly in my hand made soaps. I like it to be very viscous, sticky and have that castor oil scent. This oil fulfills all my qualifications for a good quality castor oil. It has many uses besides being a great emollient in soaps, so I will be using it for my skin and hair as well. It's one of the best that I've reviewed so far. Please note that this castor oil is for EXTERNAL use only and not to be taken internally. If you want castor oil for that search for food grade castor oil.

title: Very Good Hair Brush
text: This is the perfect sized boar bristle hair brush to put in my purse or tennis bag.  It's not too small but it's not full-sized either.  I love these types of brushes the best (especially those with bamboo bristles) because they brush all of my hair and not just the top of it.  It feels good on my scalp too.  The wood grain in the brown handle is lovely too making it a pretty brush as well as very functional.

title: Seems to be Good Shampoo and Conditioner
text: The shampoo comes out of the bottle really DARK blue but lathers up nice and white.  It cleans my hair nicely, rinses out easily and has no strong or perfumed scent at all.  I have been lightening my hair using home kits and prefer shampoos and creme rinses that help control any brassiness.  The conditioner is a much lighter color and makes my hair feel great.  It's easy to comb out and blow dry.  However, it will leave your shower floor very slick so be careful with this stuff.

title: Very Good but Pricey
text: This is a little jar of face cream for $27.98 (the price as of this review).  It feels good on my facial skin, but honestly, it doesn't moisturize it any better than many less expensive creams I've used and reviewed.  It's good, but I just don't see why it costs so much money.  The texture is close to that of sour cream and it's easy to apply.  It's a little greasy for a short while until it gets absorbed.

title: Very Good Shampoo
text: I like this castor oil shampoo though I don't know how much castor oil it contains.  Castor oil is wonderful for hair and skin and I use a lot of it in my hand made soaps because it makes them very emollient and soothing to the skin.  This is a huge bottle of shampoo and will last me a long time.  It makes very good lather - nice and light and it rinses out well.  My hair is very clean afterwards.  I still use a good conditioner afterwards because my hair is a little damaged from being lightened.  This shampoo has a very light scent too.  There's nothing negative I can find to say about it.

title: Very Good Plastic Headbands
text: I'm particular about headbands and have reviewed some that just didn't work out too well for various reasons. However, these headbands (2 in a pack) are holding my hair out of my face just fine, and they don't get my head sore after wearing one for several hours.  They are made out of breakable plastic so I have to be a little careful with them, but they are very pretty in their unusual colorful design.  They have tiny little teeth in some spots to  grab hair and that makes the headbands very stable.  I think these are really good and am glad I finally decided to select them for review.

title: Medium Gray and Waterproof!
text: I have several of this type of eyebrow pencil but in a different shade.  These are the kind that allow you to try make lines that look like hairs though I have never been really all that good at doing that.  This is the first gray color eye brow pencil I've used and I like it pretty well.  The gray color is medium - not dark or light, but right there in the middle.  I use a very light touch and short strokes to get the color where I want it.  I have scant eye brow hairs and have to fill in to make it look like I have full eyebrows.  I like how this did, it seems to be waterproof and I really need waterproof because I play a lot of tennis and sweat a lot on the court under the hot sun in the Deep South.  I sweated a lot at practice last night and when I woke up this morning my eyebrows were still mostly there.  I can't complain about that.

title: Excellent Natural Deodorant
text: I checked the ingredients list of this non-aluminum containing deodorant and everything that's in it is what I put in my own home made deodorants.  Shea buttter, coconut oil, arrowroot powder, cornstarch, essential oils, etc...  It has a lovely scent, and you don't need much.  It won't stop sweating, but it will keep the smelly bacteria from breeding for a while so you don't stink.  I could feel the slight graininess of the cornstarch and arrowroot powder which let me know it was good quality.  I really like this and feel it is every bit as good as my own homemade deodorant.

title: Very Well Made Metal Headbands
text: These headbands are made out of strong metal and are well painted.  I like them but find that the tips are a little irritating - need more rubber on the them.  The wavy part sort of grabs my hair in a comb-backed way, but not all of it so I have to decide it I want my front hair loose or try to get the waves to comb more of it back.  These are very well made and should last a long time.  I haven't tried wearing more than one at a time but that might be a good idea.

title: Good Bamboo Brush with Comb
text: I love bamboo brushes with bamboo bristles.  They feel so good on my scalp - like a scalp massage when I brush my hair with them.  This brush is really good, though I would have liked for the bristles pegs to be a little longer.  I find I have to push the brush down harder to get to my scalp.  I have another bamboo brush with longer bristles that I like best but this one is still a very good brush especially if you have short hair.  The comb that comes with it is good for getting tangles out of thick hair and one of my kids has laid claim to it.

title: Excellent Product
text: I can't tell if my teeth are any whiter or not after using but I can tell that my sink and counter top are a lot darker.  It's messy.  But I still like it a lot.  The powder is very fine and not coarse, and has no flavor.  It think the activated charcoal is very good quality.  I use activated charcoal a lot but not so much for brushing my teeth.  I make handmade soaps and I like to make BLACK soaps because they are so cool looking and clean the skin so well.  I used some of this in some soap and it worked great!  The toothbrush is good and so is the tongue scraper though I prefer a larger tongue scraper.

title: These Work Great
text: These are just what I need to keep some loose hairs around my face from flying around and getting into my eyes.  I played a tennis match yesterday and the wind was just ferocious.  If I didn't have these little barrettes in my hair I would have gone nuts.  These are perfect for when you need a lot of them at one time like I did yesterday.  I think I had at least 8 of them in my hair at one time but they looked fine and I like the choice of colors and they worked perfectly.

title: Very Good Lip Balm
text: I pretty much have chronically dry, chapped lips, especially in the winter.  I'm frequently grabbing my lip glosses, balms, and anything greasy that I can put on them.  I find that this Pharmacopia Tangerine-Flavored Lip Balm is very soothing to my poor lips and really makes them feel so nicely moisturized.  It goes on easily and is clear if I want to use some on the back of my dry hands when I can't find any lotion.  I can't really taste any tangerine flavor, but the scent is definitely there and is very pleasant.

title: Too Expensive for What You Get
text: I've reviewed other lotions that were pricey like this one, as of this review this Kale Firm & Smooth Body Lotion costs $25.90.  I think that's kind of expensive because though it's a good moisturizer, it's not a great moisturizer.  I can put it on my face, arms and hands and it feels good, but my skin is not as moisturized as some other lotions and creams that I've used.  I like the shape of the bottle because I can keep it in the slot in my car door and use it as needed.  But, I wouldn't be real thrilled if I paid nearly $26.00 for a 6.8 fl. oz bottle of this lotion and only got an average level of moisturization.

title: These Work OK
text: These face lift tapes aren't bad as long as you don't get your hopes up that you will look 20 years younger.  I'm nearly 62 and my facial skin is sagging - the reason for me selecting these face lift tapes when they appeared on my list of items I could review.  Your skin must be clean, dry and free of any moisturizers.  They stick well to my skin and definitely pulls it up some.  However, the skin that's pulled up gets crinkled up and if your hair doesn't cover it, the crinkles will show.  The tapes are really hard to see once applied, and easy to apply once you get the hang of it.  I blew through at least 10 just trying to figure it out but you get 40 in a box.  Again, these do work, and help eliminate some drooping skin, but they aren't a really good solution, imho.

title: Great For Scraping Gunk Off the Tongue
text: These tongue scrapers do an excellent job of getting all the yucky stuff off your tongue which is LOADED with bacteria and is the main source of halitosis.  I always brush my tongue with a stiff bristled tooth brush, then my teeth with my Sonicare and to finish off the routine I use my tongue scraper to get the last bit of slime off my tongue.  I've used a plastic tongue scraper for years and it does real well and so do these metal ones.

title: Organic Argan Oil???  I Don't Think So
text: I was really happy to receive this 4 oz. bottle of "Organic Moroccan Argon Oil" but it does not appear to be very organic nor pure argan oil.  It's loaded with other chemicals, and perfume.  Upon opening the bottle I wondered why it had a scent, was clear and somewhat thin.  I have several other brand of PURE Argan oil and it is thick, yellowish and has a musty/dirt-like scent.  I can't give this Livordo Argan oil a high star rating since what it advertises doesn't seem to be what you get.

title: Too Rough For Me to Use
text: These are o.k. nail files, but I wouldn't use the gray side at all as it too rough.  I would use the buff side to actually file my nails - if I wanted to use them.  I find the thickness of the nail file a little hard to hold and will continue to use my wonderful slim glass nail file and super fine sandpaper to smooth the edges.  I play and teach classical guitar and I need my nails to be just right to get good contact with the strings and these nail files leave my nails too rough on the edges.  They are well packaged and colorful and would make a nice gift for someone who isn't as fussy as me about their nails.

title: Good Nail Polish Remover
text: I used this nail polish remover today to remove some nail polish that was 3 layers deep and hard dried.  I first used a Kleenex and it wasn't abrasive enough so I changed to a paper towel and was able to get the polish off faster.  I really can't tell if this nail polish remover is any better than most other brands but it works well enough.

title: Works Really Well
text: This nail polish remover is not watered down like the cheap kind you buy at Wallmart.  This really got some old, thick nail polish off quickly and easily.  That said, I only had my toes painted so it was not really possible for me to stick my toes in the jar and rotate them so I took the sponge out, gave it a squeeze to get to the excess nail polish remover off and went to work with on my toes.  It was very easy and very fast.  This nail polish remover is at least 3x better than what I have in bottles underneath my bathroom sink.  I think as the nail polish remover is used up and/or evaporates I will refill it with more nail polish remover.  The pink sponge was soft, yet still rough enough to get the old nail polish off.  At first I was thinking this thing was going to be a bust, but it has turned out to be extremely useful.

title: Good Sonic Toothbrush
text: I like this sonic toothbrush a lot - the color is so retro pink and lovely and it seems to do as good a job as my expensive Phillips sonic toothbrush.  It has a tough case for traveling, sits nicely on it's charging stand and has 6 extra tooth brushes.  I just wish it took the same kind of toothbrushes as my Phillips sonic toothbrush.  They are so close to being the same size to fit, but the post on this toothbrush is too big for my replacement Phillips heads to fit.  So, replacement heads will have to be ordered specially and sometimes finding non-brand sonic toothbrush heads can be hard.  I have another sonic toothbrush that I love, but can't find any replacement toothbrush heads for it.  Other than the toothbrush heads, I think this is an awesome sonic toothbrush, does a great job (has lots of different settings but I only use one), and will make a retro bathroom look even more retro.

title: These Will Shave Off Facial Hair Just Fine
text: I've never seen anything like these facial razors before so when they came up on my list of items I could review curiosity got the better of me.  That said, they aren't bad.  I'm at that age where I might spring an unwanted facial hair or two which I have to remove immediately upon detection.  I used (carefully!) one of these small razors to try shaving just a small area of my face and it really did remove all the peach fuzz.  I can't say that they are any better than a ladies electric facial shaver I've been using, but these would be a lot easier to carry in my purse just in case I needed to use one.  They seem well made and one razor should last a long time.  These are sharp, but kind of serrated at the edge so be careful with them.

title: Good Mask
text: This mask is very soft and molds itself around my bird beak nose pretty well.  I can still detect the tiniest bit of light but it's a lot better than any of my other masks I have for blocking out light.

title: Didn't do Much For Me
text: I've used this serum several times and I can't say I noticed any "tightening" or any smoothness occurring.  It looks cool in the bottle being gold-ish with sparkles, but it did little to help my face feel moisturized.  I have to go over it with a good moisturizer.  The little beads rubbed in o.k. but again, nothing really happened.

title: Gorgeous, lasting color!
text: I love the name - Cinnamon Roll! That's exactly what it looks like with a rich, glossy shine that isn't too tacky and stays on my lips for a long time. It applies smoothly with no clumping and I want to try other colors, it's so fun!

title: My favorite hair yet!
text: I absolutely LOVE the colors in this hair, a mixture of honey, gold and auburn and I have received so many compliments on it. I am going to get more for sure! There is more than enough hair, eight packs for the crochet install and it is a great style for winter because it is warm too! The hair is thicker so it is also easy to remove and re-use if you want!

title: Very pretty hair, looks awesome!
text: These crochet packs of hair are ready to use right out of the bag and are soft. The hair is of great quality with no tangling upon installation and looks even more perfect after sprayed with some oil sheen when done. I will definitely be using this hair again!

title: Very pretty bottles and atomizers work very well.
text: I am so glad to have received these as I love perfume and when I travel I am not taking a very expensive bottle to the airport in order for it to be confiscated. So I just will these instead! Because there are five, you can decant your favorites (just spray into the empty bottle) and don't even need to fill it up all the way in order to have your favorite fragrances with you. Also great for people who make perfumes or want to decant samples for others!

title: Not crazy about the smell, but nice protection.
text: This is a good hand cream for winter, though the fragrance is much lighter than I'd hoped for a hand cream that needs to be applied often during winter after washing hands more frequently, etc. The cream itself provides nice protection though.

title: Terrific value and quality.
text: Argan oil has a distinct but subtle scent, and it is the first thing I look for when using it. This passes the smell test and feels wonderful when I apply it to my face and hair. Because such a little goes a long way, it will last me some time and is a great buy.

title: Great software suite for small business at excellent price!
text:
Ready to to get 2019 under swing with sure footing? This software suite is perfect for the small business with big goals and the features assure you can accurately assess where you are with your finances as you meet them. My brother is a real estate agent and while there are other industry-specific programs for that, he is really enjoying this QuickBooks so far because it allows him to track his expenses, listings aka inventory, commissions and taxes that must be precise with each transaction. Secure import of financials was a relief, and he was set up in about an hour or two and learning his way around the program with relative ease. He also has an assistant that he was able to easily add to the payroll and able to do so without the free support!

Considering the list price on this new 2019 edition of Quickbooks is close to $500, the current offering is a steal and I recommend jumping on it before the price goes up again, as these sorts of offerings tend to fluctuate. QuickBooks is the most popular and affordable software compared to others on the market, and you do get what you pay for, so the value here is terrific too. I just began using the regular 2019 since I am on a smaller scale and this version is new to him, so I can't comment on the issues others are having. But considering the expense of upgrades and support on other platforms, this felt like the safest bet and I hope it stays that way!

title: Nice and cooling
text: I immediately washed this and put it in the freezer (just threw roll) and used after I got out of the shower and it really felt amazing. I rolled across my whole face for about 5 min until it felt nice and cool and then moisturized. This will definitely be apart of my routine for now on especially in the summer!

title: Works great!
text: It works really well, even in the dry and frigid winter air. Non-greasy and moisture rich.

title: nice foamy cleanser
text: One pump produces a mound of foam (slightly smaller than a golf ball) that is like a thin shaving cream. It has very little scent, covers my face easily, and rinses well. My skin felt clean and smooth after use.

title: Decent dupe
text:
The product itself is decent.
It reminds me of oil of olay. But it's about half the price has no scent. Feels nice, light weight and hydrating. More of a daily use face cream

However, this was a two pack and I was only sent one.

title: great primer at a great price
text: works great at plumping up my lashes before putting on my mascara

title: Nice looking kit
text: Nice looking kit. couldn't find in local stores so ordered on line. work great. More tools then you will ever need. some I don't even know what there for.

title: Works best on normal nails not thick ones
text:
This is a handy set of stainless podiatrist style nail trimmers and tools that come in a zippered storage case, making it convenient for travel or storage.

The set includes one curved clipper, one angled one, a lifter for ingrown nails, a pusher for cuticle care, and two different files for smooth finishing. The angled main clipper has a non-adjustable internal tension spring and a coated ergonomic shaped hand grip, while the other clipper has a coated non-ergonomic shaped grip.

When trying to cut through tough thick nails you need a sure grip. Unfortunately, the grip coating material used on these clippers is hard and not padded, therefore failing to provide cushioning to users with arthritis or to provide a non-slip grip.

I tried these clippers on my father's thick toenails, and they do cut, but not as sharply or precisely as the professional grade clippers I usually use on his nails. Instead of one clean cut, it took several clips to get through his tough nails with these and because of that the finish was jagged and needed filing to smooth out.

Though I wouldn't recommend this set for seniors, I do think the curved shape of the larger clipper is a nice touch though, so they're useful enough for regular nails and handy to pack if you're planning a trip.

title: Sturdy stainless pet comb
text: This stainless steel pet comb is well made and sturdy enough to detangle my Maltese's long hair with ease. I've gotten it wet numerous times and upon air drying it hasn't shown any signs of rust, so the stainless appears to be of good quality. This comb is constructed well so it should last for years to come and I'm very satisfied with my purchase.

title: Just love them
text: I love these brushes they have made my artwork even better than what it was the blending with these brushes is absolutely wonderful

title: Random colors
text: It was a risk buying a random set of colors and of course I got mostly ugly ones, but this is by far the best polish out there and the price for the random set is great.

title: As described
text: The brushes are great and good quality

title: Eyeshadow crayons.
text: Very cheaply made. The crayon keeps falling out. The colors are good. I am reminded that you get what you pay for

title: I love it
text: This drill is by far the best I've had yet...

title: Good quality
text: Nice brush

title: You will need extra packs if you have a big head
text: I love this hair it's very soft and the twist look very pretty but if you have a large head buy extra I had to buy and extra pack and I still didn't have enough for my whole head by the time I spent money on extra packs I spent almost $90 so for me the price was kind of high I Never paid that much for synthetic hair I wish more twists came in each of the packs

title: Underestimated difficulty
text: Impossible to wear comfortably and the magnets should be spread out better for a more even or more realistic look because they are only on the ends.

title: Breathe of fresh air!!
text: Other than the actual piece being a little small on my face it def makes breathing much better. Also, helps with fogging of glasses (if you wear them.)

title: Almost nice
text: The original scent is pretty, but this particular batch is beyond shelf life.

title: Five Stars
text: I like the colors.

title: love the pallete of colors
text: eyeshadow stays on all day

title: Great stuff. Really does what it says
text:
I've used the lotion deodorant and ordered the stick to be less messy. Will see if this is as good.
Best ,most effective deodorant I've ever used. Not a great smell out of container but adjusts as it's on your body.
It's spendy but it truly amazing .
I do love the warm vanilla out of all the fragrances
I'm hoping the solid stick is a bit longer lasting . If it is it will be a better deal .

title: Love
text:
LOVE this stuff. We are the fairest of them all. Irish ancestry through and through.
Pretty sure I had sun poisoning. This stuff was the only thing that saved me. Its not sticky. It works immediately.
We do our best to not burn but it does happen. And this stuff rocks. There's even some with added lidocaine. Amazing.

title: It works!
text: Honestly I was very skeptical about this product because it was on the cheaper side and the reviews were up and down. I figured what the heck it's not to expensive take a chance. I'm so glad I did. I put it on my eye brows every night before bed and apply some to the tip of my finger and put it on my upper lashes where eyeliner would go. I would say it does take a few weeks to see a difference but be patient and apply it every night and you won't be disappointed. I get so many compliments on my eyelashes that people now think they are fake!! HahA!🤣

title: Four Stars

title: Very pigmented
text: I discovered nyx white eye shadow a few years ago. I fell in love because it's very pigmented which is exactly what I like. I do a lot of bold looks. Nothing else I've tried compares! I went to ulta beauty to buy more and that lady told me they completely stopped making the single pallet of white. I was so sad. Come to find out they didn't. When I came across this I was so happy. Might seem a little expensive for 1 tiny thing of it but all make up is expensive.  This is definitely worth it if u like ur white eyeshadow to be just that. Bright white!

title: These aren't gel, like the written description says!
text: Be aware the description says “gel” polish but they are not!  The colors are not even the nice ones on the picture.  They give you random colors, the unpopular ones for sure.

title: Great Buy
text: My daughter didn't want to take these out even though they were quite heavy due to the length! She got plenty of compliments everywhere she went. I definitely recommend them.

title: Great value!
text: Great value and sturdy combs. Great use and I recommend them!

title: Very hard brush but worth it!
text: Super hard brush I repeat very hard. This brush is not for the tender headed. I recommend a 4-6 week length before using this brush. I'm at a 3 1/2 week wolfs day the brush is still kinda hard. I'm sure i will get used to it but for now my blue 350 medium still has excellent pull!! Good quality and it has become expected since I own several of these brushes.

title: Must buy!!
text: Works great, worth the money, buy it, and you will never have to buy another brush!!

text: They are beautiful. The box is so cute it keeps everything in order. I would personally put them on before eye shadow that way the eyeliner will stick fully to your lid. You have to allow the eyeliner to dry fully. It doesn't take as long as the glue. I like to use the tips on my nail to press a little on the magnets they stick with no problem they don't lift. I love them. I definitely recommend and will buy again.
